These are significantly better at noise cancelling which I can appreciate. However some things I have problems with besides the quality of sound is they are tolerable to wear for a period of time with glasses but after that period they can start causing a headache and just be extremely uncomfortable. With that said they do hold secure to my head and don't really move unless I'm moving my head a lot. I've been using them on and off for 3 days now and still haven't charged them (and they came with only a half charge at that) which is incredible to me. The other problem I have is it is extremely catered to Apple I believe. When in Bluetooth mode I had a difficult time connecting even with instructions, the volume up and down/ play pause button is a hit and miss whether it wants to work or not, and trying to go back a song does not work at all. It usually just skips 3 or 4 songs ahead. When it is connected via the wire the button on the wire is useless unless I need to pause and play. The volume buttons do not work and i cannot skip or go back songs. The final problem I had is the case. It is very limited in space which I can appreciate for on the go and packing in my backpack. However getting them into it's case can be much harder than is required.
With that being said, I do actually like these headphones and will keep them. They are a good pair of headphones. The negatives I've included have primarily been the biggest problems that I've run into.

So i thought i had something wrong with my ears but nope it's the headphones. I've been wearing all kinds of headphones for long periods of time and I've never experienced headphones that would pinch your ears and give you an ear ache that you can't rest your head on the pillow because it's too painful. I've lost sleep, work concentration and money over these. Sound quality is better than other headphones I've used but none of those $40 headphones have ever made me loose sleep. Now I can't return them after using them for one month.

I realize that these are not inexpensive headphones. I wanted really decent headphones that had a really large bass response. Beats are known for their quality and so that's what I was looking for. Fast charging that will last for a long time, meaning that I only seem to need to charge it every few days, and I use it a lot. Also very beautiful. It has invisible controls on one side of the headset, meaning that if you press one of the sides things will happen, like volume control, and most importantly, if push twice it will skip to the next song depending on how you have your source music set. I have mine set to play randomly so I don't know what is playing next. That is controlled by your unit, not the headphones. These are Bluetooth headphones and you can hook them up to anything that Bluetooth's. It also has an incredible range on it. This is my second apartment I have had them at and it actually goes perfectly from floor to floor right through the cement without sound deterioration of any kind. No I don't know what the range is, and so it may depend on your own situation, but I simply do not think that there are better headphones out there for the price. Like I said, if you are looking for excellent bass response, and I like bass, because I listen to a lot of rock 'n roll and heavy metal, then these headphones are the right ones to get. They are also very sturdy and they fold up so if need be you can put them in your coat pocket. Highly recommended.

I've had these since August 2017 and I loved them but I've noticed in the last few months, they don't seem as great. I feel like some songs are fuzzy suddenly and now like tonight, they just keep, for a lack of better word, stopping; the song will stop and I'll check the connection, it is still connected and the song is playing on iTunes, but there is no sound. I'll pause the song, push the little button on the headset, then push play on iTunes and they'll be fine again for a while. And then some nights I can't get them to work at all.

So the first thing to know about Beats is that they are optimized/equalized before you buy them. You cannot equalize Beats. That's their whole selling point is that you dont need to. Now having said that the question must be asked "is this a good thing?" And the answer is, to some degree at least, yes. These headphones are extremely well made and durable and the sound quality is by far the best I've heard yet. The battery life is insane. They advertise a 40 hour battery life at a full charge and up to 3 hours of battery life with just 5 minutes of charging. As far as I can tell these numbers are lower than the actual battery life as on my first full charge i didnt need to charge them for almost a month all while listening to them 4+ hours a day for at least 5 days a week. The only issue with these headphones is these are really made for rap/hip hop. Now don't get me wrong, I have listened to metal, country, pop, classic rock etc on them and it still sounds extremely good, but hardcore audiophiles may not like the inability to equalize the headphones themselves. All in all these are by far the best headphones I've ever owned and definitely are worth the money.

These headphones have decent sound quality for 1) bluetooth and 2) casual listening. They are on-the-ear style that come with a 3.5mm cable (for plug-in listening and full audio quality), a nifty carrying case. What I enjoy, however, is the pairing with Apple devices via their W2 chip. I recommend these for people with Apple devices (particularly if you have more than one). If you aren't an Apple user or have a mixed ecosystem, check out Sennheiser's HD series for better options.

As they are "on-the-ear" phones, you may experience fatigue after several hours. By that point, giving your ears a break (for any headphones) for a few minutes will be helpful.

Ladies & Gents this Review is best suited for those share the same interest in the following questions.
1) Is it Loud Enough?
Absolutely...., Beats by Dre now uses Apple Tech in their HeadPhone lines, held by Strong Standards giving you quality sound and durability......Read On-->
2) is It Worth the money ?
You pay for what you expect not for what you want... , They are Made for the Every Day User with Great Quality Materials and of Course Performance
3)Gloss Black Vs Black?
These are GlossBlack with look great they really are made of good materials and although it has a beautiful glossy black finish to it , its not that annoying super shiny 'sprinkling gloss'

I owned the previous model the Wired Solo 2's wich I did Enjoined but didn't fill my expectations on Quality ... The Solo 3's changes all that....
With High Quality Output Sound, Long Lasting Battery Life, and made of Great Quality materials you have everything you need in the box and the HeadPhones already come with a full charge ..... I gotta be completely Honest and say I have had them for half a day at the time of this review and wanted to write an informative review on my experience .... the quality of hd sound and battery life for daily use ... some up in One word AMAZING!!!....40 hours of battery life after a single charge or 3 hours after a 5 min. charge ...Great Quality Sound and what looks to be made of great lasting material .... Get!! I like the head phones not to mention how quickly it connects to your iPhone , now I also own an Apple Watch and was always pleased on the seamless experience of the bluetooth connectivity ...the Solo 3's give you the same experience ... giving cordless a new meaning.....

Update;
After almost 6 months of Normal Use Left Headphone gave up ( no sound) Lets see if we are covered .....

The Basics -
Build quality: 8/10
Sound quality: 7/10
Comfort: 7/10
Battery: 10/10
Usability: 8/10

I'm going to start with the build quality, which I think is excellent. Everything from the packaging to the ear pads is looks and feels well constructed. The design of the headphones is also very simple, so there is not a lot of variation in texture/materials, which gives the headphones their slick and stylish look. The only thing I wasn't very impressed with was the soft shell carrying case, which is only okay. It's good for keeping the headphones from getting tangled or caught on stuff in a bag or pack but offers very little actual protection.

Sound quality: 7/10
For on-ear headphones, the sound quality is pretty good. But at the price point, there are other headphones you could get that have better sound quality. That being said, these definitely perform well and I enjoy listening to them.

Comfort: 7/10
As with pretty much any on-ear headphone, these do start to get uncomfortable to wear after a while. However, I find that I can wear them a good 2-3 hours before they start to get tiring on my ears. I also find that I rarely use them for that long, as when I'm at work or somewhere I'm sitting, I probably won't be using these. So they're great for traveling, around the yard or house, at school, etc, but probably not a primary headphone.

Battery: 10/10
The battery on these is amazing. I believe the battery is listed for 40 hours of use, and I would say that's about accurate. I have yet to have the battery die,

Usability: 8/10
The power button is small but easy to locate, the headphones connect super fast to my phone (almost instantly), and the play/skip and volume controls are accessible and easy to navigate without any thought.

Overall I've been super happy with these and would recommend them to any looking for a stylish and good sounding pair of school/travel headphones.

These are very good headphones, but for the steep price, I was a little disappointed. Main points:

1. SOUND QUALITY: This is the most important part of the experience and this is the downfall of the Solo3. The base is too overwhelming, resulting in an overall muddy sound. I was actually quite surprised at how bass heavy these were the moment I first turned them on. Mid range and tenor sound tight and crisp without flaws, but its simply a bit over weighed by the intense bass. Of course this is a subjective determination...but count me in in the "this is too much bass" group.

2. WEAR: These are a bit heavy, more so than an accompanying pair of wired headphones, but the weight in itself is not intrusive. The headphones fit tightly, but after some time the ear pads do slightly pinch my lower earlobes. Its not a deal breaker, but again, I was expecting something engineered flawlessly for comfort for the price.

3. CONNECTIVITY / BATTERY LIFE: Excellent coverage on these for blue tooth. I can walk almost up to 10 meters away in a different room before these start fritzing out. A huge plus is the very long battery life. As I listen to music at work non-stop, I was sick of having to recharge headphones every 5-6 hours or so. I charge these once and they last several days and into the weekend as well sometimes.

I recently re purchase beats solo 3 black hoping for a great experience. Out of the box everything was great and working without any issue. Travel to San Francisco didn’t have any issue. On my return trip back to my home state I experience charging issue with the beats solo 3 headphones where the battery would not take a charge and stayed on red. I tried different cables and used an ac to USB charger still same results. I stop by apple and they would have to send it out for two weeks I was still under 30 day purchase period and had them returned. I waited and purchase another pair recently hoping for a great experience worked great no issues until today. My headphone were charging all night with no issue 5 white lights. Went to the gym notice it was at 3 white light s strange. 1 hours of working out the headphones stop working. Stop by apple they said try to reset and charge again if issue continue they would send it out for service two weeks. Came to the office and attempted to reset and charge my beats solo 3. The unit would not charge pass 1 white light for 2 hours. There seems to be issue with beats solo 3 not sure what it could be but I will wait before purchasing again.

These Beats are great when it comes to sound quality, mobility and battery life. The design is beautiful, they fold compactly and come with an aux cable so they can be used plugged in to things such as console controllers, monitors, laptops etc. The connectivity with my iPhone is great and the bluetooth range is impressive ( I was able to leave my phone on one floor of the house and go in to the basement and did not lose connection.) There are two down sides to these headphones however, the somewhat fragile folding system and the clamping weight. Basically you fold the headphones over on to themselves to store them and it seems like you can easily break them this way if you aren't careful. The clamping weight is the pressure these headphones put on your ears while they're on. After anywhere between 20-40 minutes of use, I usually have to take them off and readjust them to ease ear soreness. The heavy clamping weight helps these headphones stay on your ears however while moving around/exercising but unfortunately hurts your ears a lot.

Pros:
- Great mobility
- Great connectivity
- Great sound quality
- Great battery life

Cons:
- Fragile design
- Clamping weight (hurts ears over time)
- Price (if looking for budget headphones or if you don't get them on sale like I did)

Hope this review helps.

I'm not an audiophile but husband is and currently own real great sounding headphones. I've got this ship n sold by amazon and it's 100% authentic and was able to register. We're not an apple household and I only bought this out of long time curiousity and it's battery life.
Coming from Sony and other high end brands, this beats is not really that special audio wise. The bass is good but it is too bass-y for my liking I find it annoying sometimes. It sounds great in upbeat songs because of heavy bass but too muddy and noisy in mellows. I am more into soul, jazz, classical, pop, country, acoustic, 70s 80s classics and the likes so this isn't my go to headphone. I cannot stand this headphone when it comes to slow songs. When I'm in a mood for some upbeat reggae then this is it.
It's overall nice quality, sound is good, just not $200 let alone 300 good. People saying this is the best in market probably never tried the really good ones out there (and it's okay). Glad I bought this at a deep sale price or I'd be crying by now. My $100 Sony & Bose sounds just as good and even better and clearer on most songs in my list. If we have same taste in music, look for something else, you'll find some with same sound quality but at a significantly lower price. And if you want to buy this, do yourself a favor, buy this on sale coz it's really not worth it's regular price. It's only worth $150 tops and that's already a stretch. If you've never owned expensive headphones and been saving $ to buy one then please look somewhere else: sony, bose, audioTec, bowers, beyerdynamic, sennheiser.
I'm keeping this not because of the sound but for my upcoming long international travel. I needed something that will survive me forever without charging since I'll be in the airport and plane for 2 days. The battery life is aweeesome- best out of all my bluetooth headphones!

These are the real deal. Once I turned on the Bluetooth on my phone the Beats Solo software automatically appeared. It seamlessly connected to my Apple Watch as well. The Matte Black comes with grey lettering on top which also indicates that it is real. The sound is nice and crisp, especially with some old school Metallica. The headphones feel extremely comfortable, sturdy and light.

UPDATE: The USB BROKE IN ONE DAY. AMAZON REPRESENTATIVE INFORMED ME THAT ITEM IS REFURBISHED and NEW WHICH WAS ADVERTISED.

It might seem harsh to ding the headphones for a software issue, but the reason you're paying a premium on these headphones is for the W1 chip, which makes it integrate better into the Apple ecosystem. If you're on android, there are better quality headphones for the price.

The W1 chip does let switching between apple devices work seamlessly, but the new iOS update (that I understand they have no intention of fixing) makes these completely unusable. I had to dismiss this popup 50 times a day whenever my headphones are near an iOS device. This happens on a device that's currently connected OR NOT. And when it's not, there's not even an option to connect. I have to dismiss this dialog in order to manually connect.

This is not a seamless experience. If I open my phone I want information quickly, I don't want to be reminded that my headphones exist. Do Not Disturb mode doesn't even and this misery.

Amazing headphones, I use them to do transcription and I am able to hear every single word without the strain or difficulties I had with previous headphones. The color is gorgeous and I love that it came with a case, cords and even a clip to put on the bag for when I'm traveling. The soft inner cushions for the ears are superb and very comfortable. I was worried that the white would be difficult to keep clean or would not look good but once I received them I saw that this would not be an issue. Controls on the headset are very easy to use, quick to connect to computer, laptop or cell phone and the sound quality is superb. I am very pleased with these amazing head phones and they truly are worth the splurge.

Overpriced. You can either buy for the beats name or spend half the amount of money and get something equal, if not better quality. These will break easily due to being made of cheap material. Then if you try to fix them yourself, you will need a whole set up (Soldering kit, replacement parts, and a steady hand). You’ve been warned.

As a senior citizen (69yrs) I don't like ear buds. This was everything I wanted & more. I love the rose gold color & the sound was phenomenal!!! Unfortunately, on Feb. 4, 2018 our house burned down; we lost everything except the clothes we had on. Now I'm looking to replace some of the things I lost. This is first on my list.

I had the Beats Studio Wireless before I got these Beats Solo 3. The reason I got these was because of the Apple chip inside of them that makes it easy to connect them to your Apple products. Let me just say, connecting has never been easier. It just pops up and your connected. Done. Other than that, they look and sound great. They sound just as good as the Studios but I like how they are smaller. They do wear on your ears and the top of your head after a couple of hours of use. You'll need a little bit of a break. However, I enjoy these more than my Beats Studio Wireless head phones. The gold color looks just like the iPhone gold as well. A really sleek pair. Lastly, the battery life is unreal. They last FOREVER. I went a month until I had to charge them again with moderate use. They charge very quickly too. Battery life is not an issue with these. If you want a great, stylish, pair of headphones that sound great pick up a pair of these. If you have an iPhone these are a must with how flawlessly they work with the Apple devices. Highly recommend.

Recently purchased these and have owned them for about a month. Love them and the sound quality for the most part; however, the left half of the headphones have completely blown out without warning, so now only the right side is producing sound. Very disappointed in the quality of these for the price that was paid for them. Who wants to listen to music with only sound going into one ear?

I'm not a headphone expert and maybe I was expecting there to be a live concert in my ears but these haven't wowed me in the slightest. The ear cups are small and can get pretty uncomfortable how they sit on your ears, the sound is just ok. Not bad but like I said, I got just as good of a sound from a less expensive pair and to top it off, they pull my hair out every time I take them off. With everything considered, I wouldn't buy them again. I'm giving them to my kids and whatever happens to them, happens. I should have stayed with my less expensive brand.

I really wanted these and have owned Beats Solo2 that were great. I had to return this product 3 TIMES!!! So aggravating they do not work like they used to and have failed to the point of my having to return. Lost connections and wouldn't reconnect; I have a new Iphone and it didn't work as stated in pairing; you're supposed to just open them and they automatically put a box popup on your phone where you say connect. Worked once. Then when they failed, I totally reset and went to start over totally, and no popup whatsoever. I am beginning to think Apple has done something to mess these things up since they now own the company. Anyway, cannot recommend them.

First review, more reviews to come the longer I wear This head set.
Wore them to the gym, they did not shift in any direction while wearing them. I wear glasses, I placed then just below my upper earlobe, no year pain after an hour in the gym.
Sound was great, kept it at 3/4 volume, was just the right level to get going, but low enough to hear if someone was trying to tell me something.
Quality feels good and durable.
I have an Android phone, easy to connect to. I also have a Kindle, also a breeze to connect.

These headphones did not disappoint. There is not one bad thing I can say about them. Great quality. Great sound. I had no problem pairing them to my iPhone and MacBook. And yes, THEY ARE AUTHENTIC. I would suggest avoiding buying them from third party sellers, I believe that is why some people are receiving knockoffs. I would also suggest avoiding buying used Beats. Buy them new if you want to be sure you receive the authentic ones. For some reason the (white and gold) Beats were $30 cheaper when I bought them... they went up in price the day after I purchased them. If you happen to see them for a great deal, don't hesitate to buy them. If you're still worried about getting a knockoff, you can always price match at Best Buy.

These headphones arrived today. After wearing them off and on throughout the day, I have enjoyed their quality in materials and the sound quality is great. I was worried that they'd be heavy on bass, but they're a good balance. I've listened to several genres of music and even some podcasts and the quality is consistent throughout all areas. My only complaint is that these headphones are not comfortable to wear for extended periods. After 30-45 minutes, they start to hurt becuase they put a decent amount of pressure on my ears. This is kind of a bummer because I bought these to use while doing online classes and school work.
*update*
I was working at my computer while listening to a podcast on these headphones. I had to use the restroom, I was able to walk all the way upstairs and listen to the podcast while doing business without any interruption! The distance on these things is ridiculous!

I'll start by saying I had a hard time finding genuine Beats online, if you search online you quickly learn what to look for. These were a bit less than retail, so I wondered if I'd be getting an authentic pair. It was indeed authentic (Mickey's 90th Anniversary Solo3 Beats).

The headphones are gorgeous, they make me smile. The sound is definitely fantastic. I had heard mixed comments on the Beats sound quality, but I spent this morning switching between the Beats Solo 3 and Bose QC35 and I honestly prefer the Beats sound quality. Of course, the QC 35 have perfect noise cancellation, but the Beats never claim to be noise-cancelling.

My only complain about the Solo 3 is that they are on-ear as opposed to over the ear. This means the cushions rest directly on top of your ears and I found that they became a little uncomfortable after a couple of hours of continuous use. I don't know if I'll get used to it, or the cushions will soften/adapt more to my ears. But for prolonged listening, right now, I would prefer an over-the-ear pair.

I'm overall happy with the purchase and I think most people will be too.
I ordered these headphones on March 11th I got them about two weeks later. They were great for about a month and a half. However, for the last week only one side is working.

I bought these on Black Friday I was a little worried a lot of people in the comments say they are fake and bad quality I don’t believe that at all I’ve had them for months they’ve held up amazing and seem very high quality. My only small gripe is I wish they had a little more sound power and bass drive but overall I love them they stay charged for
Weeks

As you can see I have a variety of different pairs and these are the best sounding, most comfortable pair I own. Synced easily with my iPhone, and work perfect with my Series 1 Apple Watch music controller. I wasn't worried about the sync being an issue. They are so comfy even with my 3/4 size gauges, with them being metal it doesn't push them into my neck like some headsets do. They don't slip around either. They cover my entire ear and make a nice "seal" I guess you could say. Literally if they are turned up even to half the max volume I can't hear anything around me. Definitely would recommend them to anyone. I got them when they were $179 had some gift cards and such so I got a great deal on them, Amazon definitely has the best prices on these keep and eye on it if you aren't looking to drop the $300.
*Update* - Fell asleep with them on, never did that before with another headset lol.

Love these headphones. Great sound and easy to connect. Battery life is also exceptional. After having to replace many cheaper brands after a few months, I decided to test out these. I have had them only a month so I cannot speak to longevity but will update if that is a problem. I did notice that, with the first two usages, my phone dropped the bluetooth connect after about one hour (mistakenly thought the battery died) but that has not since happened.

One of my Best Buy’s (5 stars)

UPDATE- My Beats broke within a couple months internally when I just unfolded them like normal and one side doenst produce sound. I am very dissapointed because I love these things, but for $300 and they break within a year and cost half the price to repair, I reccomend to get a pair of B&o's or Bose headphone cause the sound quality is way better. If you just follow mainstream in tech, youll probably considering getting a pair of these, but they are only ok sound quality for $300 and are like getting Supreme, you get it because it has that "b" and "Beats" on it.

Obsessed!! After paying full price for these as a gift for my spouse last holiday season and listening to him brag about how awesome they were, i saw the same beats solo3 on sale during prime day. These live up to the hype, especially for less than $150! I’d been using a cheaper (yet prettier) set of over the ear headphones but they would start to feel tight after a bit, didn’t have wireless/Bluetooth option, and the sound was tinny. Now i totally get the big deal about these! They’re light weight, simple to use, the sound is AMAZING, they blocked out ambient noise like a BOSS, and are so so comfortable. Feels like pillows on your ears. Highly recommend. My hubby has used them almost daily to work out in (read: sweat like crazy) and for travel and they last!!

Munson bought with his money this headphones. I have use them to test, the sound is pretty good but I don’t like the fit, they feel too tight on my head and the ear caps feel to little. They are not the big ear cover like other ones I’ve seen. I guess they are different styles I’m just saying I like the bigger ones that cover your entire ear.
I couldn’t wear it for more than 15 minutes because of the pressure on my head.
If I compare it to my BOSE I love my Bose thousand times more.

I have had these headphones for about a year. I love them. However, the leather is coming off the head phones after a little over 12 months. Hard to justify a $300 purchase when they fall apart. After googling the issue it seems like a common issue. I contacted apple and they will not do anything to help me other than offer me a replacement for $150. If that is the case, I would rather buy another brand that will hold up. It is great the sound quality and battery life is fantastic, but if they are falling apart like this, how am I supposed to use them. Seems like a bad design. I suggest googling the issue before you buy.

Pros
Amazing 40-hour battery life
Good, clear sound on iphone7 from all audio sources (music & other audio playback apps such as YouTube)
Decent call quality for user and caller (unsure of performance in noisy backgrounds or windy conditions)
Good volume range for audio playback and phone calls
Decent noise canceling ability without integration of electronic noise canceling technology (I think ear cups are manually designed for optimum noise canceling)
Cord with high-quality mic provided with headset
USB charging fcable included (able to use iPhone wall charger or other compatible USB wall charger to charge headset as well as charging from connection to PC)
Only 2 hours charging time for full battery life
Comfortable ear cup padding
Headset controls not flimsy and easy to operate
Unbroken long-range Bluetooth connectivity using iphone7
Steller support for software updates, Bluetooth connectivity, and support questions (Beats products are owned and supported by Apple company)
Easy setup and installation with iphone7 (unsure of performance with Mac or Windows PC)

Cons
Some notable trouble using headset to answer mobile calls as well as soft phone calls (skype, what's app, etc.)
Very tight fit (tight squeeze on head causing frequent headaches, though diminished a slight bit after frequent use)
No voice feedback when operating controls (battery life can only be determined by viewing indicator LEDS; troublesome for blind user)
Strangely, no headset battery indicator on iphone7 status bar (many other bluetooth headsets show battery status next to Bluetooth indicator on iPhone status bar)

Well, as you can see, I've experienced a mixed bag of positive and negatives in using this headset. Here are some additional observations based on my experience.

* Though I'm not an experienced audiofile, the bass seems full without distorting other sounds. I experienced enjoyable audio quality when watching TV apps, youtube videos, and listening to music.
* My main purpose for trying this headset was for phone call quality by comparing them with the Plantronics Voyager 8200 series. I did experience fairly clear feedback from callers when using the headset, but callers sometimes reported a bit of distortion from my end but it was only slight. Additionally, I had frequent occurrences where, after receiving a call, I could not answer with the headset when trying to use them to answer the call. Instead, the call was routed to the iPhone itself and I had to manually route the call to the headset.

An Interesting Experience to Note

However, the strangest anomaly occurred when using this headset. From reading reviews and talking with Apple support, I was told, definitively, that this headset does not have a built-in mic when being used wirelessly (accompanying cord does have built-in mic). However, I successfully used the headset using Bluetooth connection (not with cord) and callers could hear me with no trouble. So, I reasoned that if this Beats headset doesn't have a built-in mic, then my iphone7's mic is being used to communicate with callers. However, after moving over 100ft. from my iPhone, the callers could hear me as clearly as when I was less than 5ft. away from the iPhone. So, I really don't know how my voice is being transmitted to callers when I'm communicating wirelessly with this headset. hmmm!

* In addition to trouble in answering calls with this headset, my main beef with this Beats product is the really tight squeeze on my head. Unfortunately, this tightness was quite uncomfortable to the point where I dealt with several headaches. Though I've only had these for 3 weeks, the discomfort has only diminished slightly.

Frankly, because I find the Plantronics Voyager 8200 series to have superior call quality on both ends and to be much more comfortable than these, I will most likely return this headset though it consists of many good features such as seamless connectivity with the iPhone and amazingly high battery life.

We got these on Black Friday which made them an excellent value. Overall, these headphones are very comfortable and above average from a sound quality standpoint. There are many cheaper options out there, many of which I have tried, but I think that these are really a step up. The other great thing about these was the iphone bluetooth integration which makes pairing very easy.

My first pair lasted less than a year before they started giving problems. Battery life started decreasing. Then the led on/off light wouldn't turn off so it began draining the battery. So sent it in to be repaired thru warranty company. Well they sent it back in worse condition. Headphones went dead after 3 days and would not recharge. I also found damage on the right earpiece that looks like it was preyed open with a flat head screwdriver. So I informed warranty company again and then called amazon. The rep from amazon was really cool. Said not to worry we are sending you a brand new pair instead. Love how amazon takes care of the problem better than aftermarket warranty company.

I purchased the Beats for my daughter and she loves them. This is the second set of Solo3's I've purchased for her. The left speaker failed on each pair. I've done research on the internet and learned that Beats has a problem with the left speaker failing due to a small wire being pinched during production. Unknown if this is the problem with the Beats I've purchased. The second pair I sent back for repair and am still waiting for them to be returned. Apple/Beats needs to address this problem immediately. Amazon has been great with their fast response to assisting us with sending them back for repair, however we were told ten days. It's been longer than that. Thanks

These headphones are...petite, I guess would describe it. They're on-ear, and even when extended fully the headband clamps them on to your head with a tenacity worthy of something from the first Alien movie. My ears can't take more than about 20 minutes before the aching and lack of blood circulation force me to take them off. Haven't encountered this with other on-ear headphones before - the first step in using headphones is actually leaving them on your head, and when that's not really possible, all other considerations pale in significance.

That said, the sound quality is OK, but not great. These sound better than previous Beats headphones, so Beats is definitely improving, but for the price, there are better sounding headphones. These headphones don't overemphasize bass as much as older Beats headphones did, but it's still a bass-heavy headphone. If you want to hear treble and mid-range, there are cheaper headphones that will deliver them more effectively.

I bought these as a replacement my cheap $25 bluetooth headphones. What a world of difference. Every genre of music sounds fantastic. They are a bit heavy but you get used to the weight. The controls are on the side of the headphones and are easy to use. They pair very easily with Apple products and even with Android products. I found there was a bit of delay with the signal for Kindle HD 10 but I had that same problem with my old headphones. However, the trouble didn't last long. I wore the headphones on a long 2 mile walk and although my ears got warm they did not sweat profusely. I wouldn't use them for a hard workout though. I wish the ear cups were a bit bigger because while I was walking there was a bit of pressure on my ears. They are great for sitting at home and even some light housework. The range is decent but the signal will start to break up around 500 feet away. I would recommend an arm band for your phone or mp3 device if you would like to walk around the house with them and still have good signal. They reduce a lot of exterior noise so they could be good on an airplane or library.

Purchased these head phones under 2 years ago. They are in great condition. Very little use of the past 2 years. They stopped taking a charge months ago. Finally got around to contacting Apple support about the issue. The one year limited warranty did help Apple would not replace the defective Beats Solo headset. Very disappointed with their service and not willing to stand behind their products. Recently my son had a issue with wireless Bose headset. The covering came off due to wear. They too were about 2 years old and out of warranty. Bose support send him a shipping label and replaced the headset free of charge. I'm a Bose customer for life. Rethinking buying another Apple product again.

I’m primarily comparing the beats I own to DNA monster headphones I purchased at sharper image. DNA put the beats to shame in sound quality, the quality of materials is equivalent, whereas the beats win in terms of battery.

Here is the problem; why in the world would beats be so popular if their sound quality lacks severely? My answer: Dre, and the fact that they are just cool and come in rose gold (in my case). The battery typically does last a Day, which I gotta say I love. The fact that they auto pair nicely with my phone is great too. I would recommend over-ear beats if you just have to spend the money tho, on ears do get uncomfortable. If I could do it over again, I would have lefts these overpriced headphones on the shelf.

They are so tight on my head I an unable to wear or use them -- they pinch and give a terrible headache. Also, if you wear them to workout or even walk, everystep reverberates into the ears. They are awful and they won't let me return.

I’ll get to the point.

Pros:

- Noise cancellation is superb. Nothing should disturb your music sessions with these on.

- Bass is adequate. Not earth shattering but good enough for a former bass head who had 10 inch subwoofers in my old Acura :-)

- Battery life is great. Didn’t have to charge these things for days.

CONS:

- Decibels could be louder. I tried these at max volume on all of my devices and was disappointed. Max volume should have your ears ringing but not the case here.

- mid range cords and vocals are lacking.

- The case requires effort to get the headphones inside. It should be effortless.

I have no complaints! Came in original box with everything as described. I’m not a headphone connoisseur and haven’t owned any others comparable to these so I can’t speak to how they measure up to others. I had been told they were of good quality so I got them, and I have enjoyed them so far. Easy to set up, and the charge lasts a long while. If you wear them for hours on end, your ears do get kind of sore, but i would expect that for any type of headphone like this. Does a pretty good job blocking out surrounding noise. We shall see if they stand up against the test of time and are worth the cost.

I bought these for my daughters birthday. I gave them to her yesterday. I ordered them on Amazon Prime day so the window for returning was August 18th. I assumed ( hoped) they would work directly out of the box. My daughter was so excited to get these and they don't work! One side of the headphones is silent. I am SO DISAPPOINTED and am wondering if perhaps they sent out faulty ones on Amazon Prime Day? I did not buy the warranty because I assumed these were high quality headphones that would work if taken care of. I guess I learned my lesson about buying something and holding onto it for a gift at a later date. :-(

I have 2 pair of these and both stopped working via bluetooth after about a year. If you google beats stop working in 1 ear you will see all kinds of reviews. Beats is part of Apple so the support is the worst. I would not waste your money. For the price these should last many many years.

I have had two of these. One I bought from Apple and the other was from Amazon. I tried the The Amazon one because it was about $100 less and will not hold the charge when turned off. No support from Amazon or Beats. Disappointing.

I had this unit for more than a month before returning it. Right off the bat, I didn’t like the controls being on the left side. Most people are right handed. Why put the controls on the left? Not only that but the functional layout of the controls were a little confusing. The power button (located on the right, go figure) was so tiny. I couldn’t locate the stupid thing after I had already put the headphones on. I felt like I was reading braille. I could not adjust it comfortably on my head, especially in the gym, in a good position w/o it falling every so often. I’d like to think I have a normal size head. On the plus side, the range (at least 60 ft.) and battery life (with 2/3 hrs of use per day could last a week w/o charging) was excellent. Oh, I liked the red/black combination of colors.

Finally decided it was time to throw away my old head phones since they were basically being held together by tape. Caught these on sale during amazon prime day. The wireless solo's are great for the gym. I don't have to worry about the cord getting in the way during my workouts and I can go days without having to recharge the battery. The sound quality is great, legit cant hear anything but music when I'm wearing them. My only issue is sometimes the connection isn't clear when I'm running (probably because I'm moving).

As a music lover, I could not wait to purchase my first pair of Beats. Getting the most out of music has always been a big thing for me. After saving up for months, I was finally able to purchase a pair of the Beats Solo3, only to find that after a short three months, the wrapping around the earpieces had begun to detach. After paying $230+ for these earphones, I was severely disappointed on the quality. If you do decide sink this much money into these, make sure to get a warranty.

Received these today. Genuine, brand new product in factory packaging. I had the solo2 for a long time and have been pretty rough on them, gym sweat finally killed them. So I’ve read many reviews and have owned several pairs and have come to a few conclusions. They have probably the best sound of any headphones I’ve tried, they are pretty tough and I’ve used the Apple warranty before for a broken set, they just sent me a new pair. With my past experience and what I put these through I decided to buy the 2 year extended warranty for $24, total purchase was $179.
I don’t think you’ll find a better deal anywhere on these.
I bought these headphones, and I was so excited to listen music. I brought these to the local best buy only to learn that they are fake. How terrible of Amazon selling them.

These headphones, like other beats products, have great quality not just in sound, but the design and everything that comes with it. The headphones are amazing to tune out from your surroundings and just jam out to whatever you like and not worry about missing a call or taking out your phone to adjust the volume or pausing your music or video. Everything is there on the left side phone to make your life easier. My only problem with these headphones is the On the ear design, Your better off getting Studio 3's if you're looking for comfortability while wearing these. Over long periods of time they start to hurt your ear and for instance, let's say you are laying in bed, u can't necessarily wear them while laying on your side, the only position u can wear them in bed is to face up. either way, these headphones are good, the only downside is to how long you can endure their uncomfortability that's all.

overall, if i could go back and not buy this, i would. this is more of a brand type head set, i don't believe it's worth what you're getting. i've been told you can get some for 150 that sound better than this, and i'm looking into it myself. i feel cool walking around with this expensive head set, and i suppose it's not horrible, but as for someone who is not blessed with money, i would say don't waste your money if you're expecting $250 quality, i would say these are worth about 150 instead. battery life is amazing, a 5 minute charge can last me hours, and i can listen an entire week for several hours on a full charge with out needing to charge again. i give these a 3 because there is good qualities, but the price is just a deal breaker for me.

I wish it were possible to give lower than one star. Ordered one day delivery and they came in 2 days late. But,when they came they were white when I ordered black. No original packaging, they were dirty, and the bluetooth said Sam's beats. I complained to customer service. So they sent me another pair which worked great for one day. Bluetooth function failed. I only bought these bc my beats studio quit working beyond their hard reset. But, all beats are junk. Would never recommend to even my worst enemy or the annoying kids in xbox live.

I’ve been rocking old school wired Bose QC’s for years (and never write product reviews). As a frequent traveler I rely heavily on my Bose Noise Cancelling “capabilities” - not something these Beats really have. That said, I paid $130 for this lil set-up on Prime Day - fantastic deal. A “whole” day into wearing them and I’ve got to say it just may have been the best $130 I’ve ever spent (heck, they could fall apart tomorrow for all I know). First, I’m really kicking myself in the butt for not going wireless sooner - I’m always snagging the wires on something and popping the wire plum out). Wireless is so liberating!!! The range on these things is incredible. I’ve got a pretty big house and I haven't found a reasonable area where the signal poops out (w/o curling up in a closet upstairs w/ my ipad in the garage). Second, the sound - crisp, clear and plenty loud. I’ve not taken them off since getting them - No doubt that’s going to agitate my wife:). Admittedly I’ve always been a Bose fanboy (not an audiophile though) and dismissed Beats all together as “just another shiny object w/ a great marketing angle”. My kids of course only wear Beats and tell me how much of an old man I look like with my wired Bose phones. Finally, battery life “if as advertised”. I’ve got about 12 hours on these guys so far which already impresses me:). The only “Cons” (it applies to most on-ear phones) are Noise in - they're not Noise Cancelling nor are they advertised to be / and Noise out - I’ve been listening to these things a fair bit louder than I do with my other headphones - when I take them off I notice how loud they are potentially to those around me (going to need to keep the volume at a reasonable setting I suppose). These things rock though - I keep finding myself dancing around the house and I’m no dancer. Get a pair, you wont regret it.

Used them for couple months. They died like 4 months ago. Won’t charge, won’t turn on, only one side works when using aux cable. During the the time they did work they were great. Came in original beats packaging. Everything included. Got them during a daily deal so it was a great price. These are my second pair of beats. First were mixrs from Best Buy so I know they’re the same beats value. BUT After multiple cables I contacted Apple. Was thankfully still under warranty. Currently shipping for repair. Hoping it’s covered. I was skeptical about buying something like this on amazon. But if it’s a factory issue I would defiantly change my rating to a 5 because as of now I’m not sure what the issue is. I have read that solo 3s do have a lot of issues. Hoping for the best.

I've gone through a handful of over the ear headphone throughout the ears, always trying to save a few bucks. I finally splurged on these babies and it's my greatest purchase of 2019. My main use is for traveling, I can't ever sleep on planes or in airports and with these little monsters, I'm sound asleep in minutes. Half the time, I don't even put on music, I just "activate" the super power of noise cancelling and it's like magic. I do use them while at work and even after I've had them on for hours, they're still comfortable. For conference calls, I've noticed that the quality of input sound is much better than my airpods and I have never had any clients complain that I'm hard to hear. FIVE THUMBS and A MILLION STARS!

The sound quality is fabulous. I purchased these for my husband after he kept taking mine! The most impressive feature is that they work great on your phone. I talk to clients using my beats each day and they work perfectly. Clients comment on how well they can hear me AND I can hear them crystal clear. Not only that but they are extremely comfortable whether using at the gym or for work.
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B01LWWY3E2/ref=as_li_qf_sp_asin_il_tl?ie=UTF8&tag=letmkno-20&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=as2&creativeASIN=B01LWWY3E2&linkId=8a72bd893523e5a06d944e3fe9357527
Defectuosos, un lado de los audifonos se abrió completamente, la esponja está completamente expuesta, que puedo hacer ? Tiene garantia ?
This is a scam!! These are not Beats headphones!!! Shame on you!

Had for short time and barely used went to place on my head and plastic arm cracked. Placed back into case until returning home from trip and contacted amazon who nicely said since it was 2 days out of return period apple would warranty and nicely put me through to apple. Apple had me send back but said it was physical damage and would not cover (via a note in the return box without even contacting me). Contacted amazon again as they had requested if apple didnt help. Only response was to put me back through to apple who couldn't tell me the cost to repair and diagnosis could be 100 dollar fee(according to the note).

Arrived when expected, arrived as expected. I'm a repeat buyer, this is my second pair of BEATS Solo3 headphones (the other one is still fine, I just keep one set in my home, and the other is for when I'm mobile/outdoors). The sound from these headphones is GREAT! They fit well and are comfortable. They're easy to connect to various devices (I've used them w/Samsung smart TV, iphones and ipad). They hold their charge for long periods and are easy to use (power button, adjust sound volume, mute button etc.). Highly recommend!

The sounds is good but the headphones are super tight on my ears. Makes my ears hurt after wearing them to long. I should have bought the over ear version. They don’t cancel noise. The phone microphone is super sensitive and doesn’t cancel out outside noise. They are good for short use. Good sound and connect easily to my iPhone. I think Apple could have done a better job implementing more technology and comfort to these headphones. But then again they haven’t perfected the iPods, which I love but they need to fit in my ear better.

love the sound, earcups get warm on ears. Biggest disappointment is the ear tap control.......totally worthless. It does what it wants. 3 taps back shuts it off. two taps forward................worthless. I still like them, but they are very over marketing sold. good sound, but the description is deceptive. GREAT BATTERY LIFE!

Bought this product twice. Once in 2017 and again in 2019. The first pair fell started falling apart after 3 months (headphone material). The second pair lasted a few days over the 1 year mark and although this time they didn’t fall apart the power LED won’t shut off.

I tried all the different methods on their site and what others suggested doing, but nothing worked. I contacted beats support and they said I was out of the limited service warranty period so I would need to pay $129 to have them fixed or replaced.

I bought my first pair at $200+ and the second pair at $150 and now they want another $129 to fix a problem that seems to be an ongoing issue with their product due to poor construction. Aside from that, they sound good, which is why I feel inclined to give 2 stars, but based on my experience with these headphones that’s as much as I’m willing to rate it due to poor construction and warranty services.

If you’re going to buys these make sure to get an extended warranty or purchase them at Apple with AppleCare.

My son got these for his birthday. He loves them so much! He always has them on his head and loves the wireless feature. He can have his phone at one end of the house and go all the way to the other end of the house and it is still connected. He had an issue setting it up. You hit the button for 1 second for apple phones and 5 for android. The battery last a long time. He normally charges it at night but it last all day and isn't dead at night when he goes to charge it. The sound is incredible and it is so soft and light weight on the ears and head. I would defiantly recommend these to anyone or any age that loves listening to music or watching movies on tablets/phones.

The reason why I'm giving 3 stars is because the Apple support is great and they are arranging to give me a repaired unit soon, the sound quality is really good as well, and the battery life is crazy long.
I have used these headphone really not even 6 months of regular usage, I have not really over used them, I mainly had them on the pouch, but still, in less than a year they ended up looking like in the pictures below.
I am not sure at this point if this was faulty unit from the manufacturer or who knows what.
I never dropped the headphones, never use them while on the gym, to be in contact with water, but still.
The product on the sound aspect, has an amazing texture of base, lows, it really makes you immerse on the sound itself, I just wish this wouldn't happen. Hope this helps, as many other experiences might not be the same as mine.

I bought this back in July I got the matt black. When I open the Box it came with beats charger cable and small pouch accessories and it was already charged, it was so easy to connect to my phone and took hours later to died on me. charged again took it to the gym and it was perfect the wireless comes in handy I can answer the phone and talk perfectly would definitely recommend I will be buying more for Christmas for my husband and teen son.

I love mine so much I decided to buy our daughter a set for Christmas. Iv used them for a couple of years. The sound is perfect pitch. They're easy hook up and use each and every time you use them. My favor time to use them are on a airplane flight. My ears just cant take offs or landings. I put them on and it help tremendously my ears dont plug up anymore or painful on flights. I highly reamend these.

I had to say I took a huge risk lol i saw a bunch of negative comments I was like should I get them or not. I don’t know about the other customers, but I got my Beats and I am happy with them. Real deal not Fake atleast mines were real and I got the satin gold and not “Jason’s” old headphones or bose whatever brand that headphones are. Just take care of them. I feel like most of the picture up there are for attention. None of them did an unboxing video from the beginning, its a bunch of photos. Anyone can say its fake. I will tell you this if it did not have shrink wrap on it send it back. I got new ones my cords and Accessories were in the box my beat sticker it look like it was straight from apple.

I love these headphones. I lift with them or ride my bike (not always safe, since they are noise cancelling). I love the ability of being able to zone out and listen to music.

They also bring a wire in case your rechargeable battery runs out of juice.

I generally like Beats headsets. The sound quality is great and they are elegantly constructed. This is the second Beats product I bought. The first one (Beats Studio Wireless Over-Ear Headphone) broke at the hinge after two years of daily, but careful use. I replaced them with the Beats Solo3, but they lasted exactly a year and six months before one of the speakers became intermittent and eventually stopped working completely.

Beats headsets are expensive. I don't mind paying for quality, but I this will be the last Beats headset I purchase.

I won’t buy Beats merchandise ever again. The power button to operate the wireless function on these headphones quit working within a year and a few months of purchasing. Amazon would not stand behind a replacement.
I was told to call the 800 number for Beats, and they were not helpful either. They will not replace since the headphones are only 5 months past warranty. They should last longer than 12 months because they are not an inexpensive pair of headphones. Very disappointing. Don't purchase this product unless you want to lose over $200.00.

I purchased two pairs of these as a Deal of the Day, but they are really just a Trick of the Day. Of course I saved them for a Christmas gift, months past and I never knew it was faulty. I gift one to my son, and the other to my 14 year old nephew. He was so excited .... but d*** only one side worked. I mean you want to look cool as a teenager but only one side?? What a waste of money. Its like they almost know in advance that you'll be stupid enough to hide these away long enough that the super short 30 day return period passes. And don't bother calling about how they don't work. They will just tell you that they can't help you or to call the manufacturer. Likely as not these are second rate and thus the deal. Remeber that in life nothing is this good; unless its broke.

So it will stare at you from its crisp looking box. Just not working... and you threw your $$ at it. Like a sucker.

Everyone. Please do not buy any product from Beats. All beats products are made from China from really cheap materials and other things in the making of the product. So they are sold here in the U.S for an exaggerated high amount price, and it’s a big profit for the Beats company. Don’t fall into just the brand and it’s marketing strategies. Would you rather look for well-known brand or for quality headphones, proven to work and perform outstandingly? And these other outstanding products are even cheaper than Beats. Why, because the price for Beats is an unreasonable price. The Beats are not worth that price because it’s made with cheap materials. Always research first and read reviews. I was actually in Best Buy today and they told me that Beats are the worst earphones you can buy because of how cheap they’re made. Best Buy themselves even have countless statistics and proofs that the earphone they sell are legit and actually work.

Product was offered at the best price around, prime shipping, etc....no reason to be skeptical when purchasing. The product shows up as a used returned - I pulled a long blonde hair out of the earpiece. 1/8" phone wire has black streaks on it. I paid for a brand new product and what arrived clearly had been "test driven."

These earphones are wonderful! Bought them for my husband for fathers day, they arrived perfectly in time. He looooves them. They’re easy to connect via blutooth to his phone, ipad and our TV. Battery lasts hours so they last a day-long trip. They’re great at cancelling outside noises so he can listen to an audiobook on a plane without getting interrupted, away from the hubbub. They are pricy but quality is beyond expected. This is the first paur of beats we buy but probably won’t be the last.

Bought used, but inspected, and the right side only had SOME static/sound that I could hear at top volume. Started return process and agent said he notified some dept & Beats regarding the problem, so...hopefully...this pair of headphones doesnt get sold to yet another customer. BE CAREFUL WITH USED ITEMS EVEN SOLD BY AMAZON! Headphones failed to pair to an Android phone. Phone didnt recognize them. They might work after charging, but I didnt risk it due to the cost.

Had a pair of Beats a few years ago and loved them. Bought these on Prime day for half off and as usual are my favority headphones once again. Very long battery and overall great sound. I also have Bose headphones and these are far superior in sound and quality in my opinion. I also like low end in music being a drummer.

Earpieces are falling apart. This was an absolutely joke of a product to buy. They're not being worn for working out or any activity that would warrant the earpieces to fall off of the headphone. Prior to this, the leather around the earphone was coming off, like many other reviews stated. BE AWARE, this is either an absolutely fake product, or beats are some crappy headphones. More than likely the former. DO NOT BUY! Please! Save yourself the headache.

These were what one of my grandsons wanted for his birthday. I had no idea if they really were worth the money, but he was ecstatic when he opened them, as were the other grandsons. I listened through them and it was a great quality of music and sound cancellation. I've no idea of the battery life as I've not asked him. He still loves his headphones and Nana and Papa gained big points in gift giving with these. Hah.

Got these for Mothers day last year. Started wearing them in January on a daily basis. They only lasted 4 months and then they would no longer turn on. Said theynm had a full charge but would never turn on again. Waited a few days and kept trying them. Called Apple to have them repaired and got nothing but horrible customer service. Apple just lost another fan. If they can't stand behind their products or at least build something that works longer than 4 months, they are no better than their Chinese Knock-offs. My husband bought a similar wireless pair on Amazon for $29 and they sound the same but have lasted him the entire time he has owned them with no issue. He just ordered me a pair. Could have bought 8 pair for the price of these crappy beats.

Not a knockoff.
These are the best sounding pair of headphones I’ve ever owned, and the decision to purchase was not taken lightly because of the cost. Sound quality is amazing. I’m hearing lyrics I’ve never heard before.

The ONLY downside to these is comfort. They’re fine if I’m wearing them for only an hour at a time, but any longer than that and my ears start to hurt because of the pressure. It almost makes me want to consider saving up for a pair of over-the-ear Studios.

I take care of all the electronics I own. I've gone through maybe ten or fifteen pairs of earbuds so far. These beats aren't those earbuds, and they aren't like many headsets

This is a stupidly comfortable over ear headset with the sound and design to match its Apple product cost. It has lasted me seven months without any sign of trouble. It is sturdy, easily collapsible, and a fast charge for the one or two week charge you could get out of it, even with playing music everyday. Its bluetooth connection is crystal clear and easy to configure most of the time.

However, I am a six foot adult male with a big head. I should've gone with the Beats Studio 3 since its a much larger design for a little bit more money. I don't even remember how I broke the bands on the sided of the headset, though I'm keeping them together via tape. The cost to repair the headset IN APPLE STORE STYLE costs as much as the headset, which is ridiculous. Thankfully, my beats are still fully functioning, and I plan on buying another headset when I have the money.

These headphones are great if you can get them to connect to your iPhone. It takes about 15-30 minutes every time you want to get them to connect to your Bluetooth. I’ve tried everything. My headphones power button will be flashing and my iPhone will be searching and nothing happens. You just have to keep powering off the headphones and turn them back on to flashing or keep shutting your phone off and turning it back on. The 15th time of doing a combination of those things will eventually work and it will connect.

I like these headphones because they look nice and the sound is pretty good. Unfortunately, after about an hour of wearing them, they start to hurt my ears and the sides of my head. Also the cable works for audio but the mic didn't work. I thought "no biggie" and ordered another cord but it was the same issue. Unlikely to buy again.

These are the worst overpriced headphones ever!! They will not sync with my devices, which is my main complaint. The device name is a bunch of lower case “j”. I think these were factory reconditioned. I rarely write reviews but, this is the third product I’ve purchased recently from AMAZON and had nothing but problems with!!!

Love the product however it had to be replaced because it would not charge correctly. Luckily the year warranty covered it. This is the second pair I have had. The first pair has one headphone that no longer works and it wasn’t under warranty so I am stuck paying $150.00 to get it fixed. Therefore I bought a extended warranty for the the current pair. After paying over $300 for each pair I think they should last longer without having functional issues!

I work with a lot of virtual conference calls. I had a Jabra provided through work, but couldn't pass up the prime day deal. The wireless microphone in the headset is fantastic. Very important to mute as it will pick up quite a bit.

Connects with ease to all my devices--iphone, bluetooth dongle on desktop pc, work lenovo laptop.

I seem to only have to charge once per week. I was torn between this set and a bose set. I don't regret my choice.

I wish i wouldve just bought these at the store brand new instead of on here. Headphones are not new!!! Ive had them barely over a month and they wont stay charged for the bluetooth and now the sound is going out. I've only worn these probably a handful of times.

I got these headphones to replace a Phillips brand that more than exceeded my expectations for the price I paid. I chose Beats brand because of their quality reputation and was really excited for their noise cancellation ability. While the unboxing was impressive and I enjoyed a full charge at arrival, these offer absolutely no noise cancellation as advertised. I bought two pair: one for myself and one for my kiddo. For the price I paid, I am extremely disappointed.

I purchased these to finally go wireless with less ports on my work machine than before and I got to use these for about 6 months before they stopped charging completely, rendering them useless as wireless headphones.

They’re very pretty, and the folding aspect with the case is clever. The wire for using them as wired is nice but, if I wanted wired headphones I wouldn’t have paid an extra $100 for these.

Additionally, it’s worth noting that you should be aware of the size of your head. I wear glasses and found these very uncomfortable to wear after an hour or two because they pushed the arms of the glasses into the sides of my head. I could get around it by pushing the arms of my glasses over the ear cushion but this obviously messed with my astigmatism prescription.

The charging problem is not a one-off thing. Do a web search and see that many people have needed to fix this and it involves cutting open the headphone to rewrite it yourself.

I bought these because they were on sale for $140 that day. That’s a decent price for them. I wouldn’t pay much more though. They are a little tight and pinch my ears after awhile—my head is not huge.

NOTE: the studio version has noise cancellation, the solo version does not. I bought these bc they were cheaper and the noise cancellation function gives me motion sickness.

My fiancé gifted these to me for Christmas to replace my old Beats which were not wireless.

I love these so much! The color is beautiful and actually matches my hair. Sometimes my family tries talking to me not realizing I can’t hear.

The battery has up to 40 hours and it really does feel like it lasts forever. I can’t wait till I travel again because they are going to be amazing to use.

I highly recommend.

These headphones were terrible! When the box arrived, it was not completely sealed. It looked as if it had been previously opened. Also, the zipper to the carrying case that comes with it was broken.

After using it only 4 times, and within the first week of owning them, the material broke away from the plastic on the right side air phones as shown in the picture. Also, the headphones plastic cracked and split open and the backing to the auxiliary device mic fell off and wouldn’t click back on. I question the authenticity of this product. I feel like I purchased a knock off sent to me in an original box. Not happy. Returning them.

I will admit I am a long-time review lurker, but never actually post reviews here because I'm lazy. However, I felt as if I should give an honest review for these, as the holiday season is approaching.

I'm a HUGE music guy and have had a pair of Beats and every On-Ear model since they first rolled out. My Solo 2 wired in headphones got stolen out of my luggage and I recently got the iPhone 8, so I figured it was finally time to venture into the "Wireless" territory. I purchased the Solo 3 Wireless Gloss Black pair back at the end of September and everything came as expected and they looked awesome.

However, after 45 min at the gym and them being fully charged, they just turned off and would not power back on. I tried numerous Youtube videos of resetting them and charging them, but nothing. I chatted with an Apple associate and ended up bringing them in to the Genius Bar and even they were baffled at what was going on. I sent them in for repair and got them back a few days later and after one use the same issue occurred.

I then went to the Apple store again and we looked at everything, software on my phone, the headphones, etc, and they were still baffled. I sent them in again and they sent me a new pair. This new pair worked well, but would not power off (light always flashing) and also would not charge at all. Maybe it was just the Gloss Black style? I don't know.

Finally, after about a month of frustration, I sent them back to Amazon and searched forever on Amazon for a new pair of great wireless headphones (since I used gift cards to buy this), but could not find anything that had the fashion, fit and sound that I liked from my Beats.

As a loyal Beats fan, I insanely purchased a new pair of the regular Black Solo 3 Wirless beats and so far everything has been working amazingly, the sound is awesome, the battery life is insane and they fit perfectly for when I'm going running.

Moral of the story is these headphones are really great, but like they always say, "third time was a charm" and the whole process of getting there was a bit frustrating. Therefore, I caution on the side of buying any warranty on these, as all of my costs were taken care of and I didn't spend a penny extra.

I'm a headphone enthusiast and I love these headphones. I have Sennheiser 600HD's, amped, in ear monitors, in ear Bose headphones, and about 4 other cans.

I would say these are "Fun". They don't have a huge sound stage, but you can't expect a huge soundstage from on ear headphones. They sound great for Bluetooth headphones and they feel comfortable.

I originally bought these for use in the gym since I workout 6-7 days a week but honestly I sweat way too much and these only make it worse. If you're a sweater then don't get these on ear headphones, you'll be miserable, you'd probably be better off with the in ear power beats.

I give these 5 stars though because they just sound fantastic. And they have a 40 hour battery life. That's just wild to me. They are the best (or should I say the funnest?) Bluetooth headphones I've tried out so far and I tried out quite a few before buying these.

Ok so I’m a really picky person when it comes to headphones, I have gone through jbl, skullcandy, Apple. You get the point, I’ve been through a ton of headphones, but these ones have satisfied me the most. Alright to my review, bass: bass is alright I’d say, enough to satisfy me, not to much not to less, I will be honest when this is at max volume, it will shake your head hard, but if you can’t handle that volume I do not recommend. Sound quality: this is what I love about them the most, their sound quality is litteraly crystal clear. absolutely recommended if you just want to hear every detail of the music and video that you are watching. Comfort: the insides are made of memory foam which is really soft when worn in warm temperatures, which is really good, the top part has padding. but when in a cold temperature it gets really hard and uncomfortable, so if your looking for headphones for a cold climate, I do not recommend these, I have a couple of friends who absolutely destroyed their headphones, like torn the leather from the headphones, but to prevent that, keep it in a case at all times you are not using it, don’t leave it on the floor, on a desk, basically anywhere without its case(provided). Noise cancellation: their is some to no noise cancellation on these headphones, so if your in a loud environment your going to hear it. Noise leakage: I have tested these in a quiet environment and no one will here you, ok if it is at like max they can here it but it’s like a whisper(friend told me). So if your looking to listen to this in like a library, these absolutely for you.

These headphones were a splurge for me but turned out to be an expensive disappointment. Wireless solo3 right side stopped working after warranty expired. Took great care in keeping these headphones pristine and even bought an additional matching case. Fees to repair start at $130 with $7 shipping just to look at them. Waste of money and won’t be replacing them with Beats. I can buy better ones from other companies for less than the cost to repair or replace.

I reeeeeally wanted to like this. I have another brand already and heard my sister's Beat. I decided to get myself one. The sound quality does not justify the price. It is not far from the $37.00 wireless unit I have, but fine I was going to keep it anyways. Then the biggest obstacle was the functionality. On my headphones, I can easily maneuver back, forth and sound up and down. The Beats did not seem to have the feature. Nothing other than power on and off. I am rather computer savvy but could not make it work. Back to the MPOW unit. It functions better for me.

First off the connectivity of these is great. I was two floors above my phone and they performed like normal! I am an Apple user so that might be why it's so good. These are super comfortable and they fit my head super well! The battery life is no joke too, I charged them too 93 percent used them the entire day checked the battery and there was still 87 percent left! Once you put these on at about 5 or 6 volume everything else fades out. The controls on these are also super helpful. You can adjust the volume, activate Siri, pause songs (works with Spotify) and pick up and hang up calls, I mean what else could you want. These look super sleek on your head. I recommend the matte black because then they don't take fingerprints and scratches easily. One other thing is the mic. It might just be me but there is a slight echo so you can hear what you are saying. Everyone that I've called says that I sound great! In conclusion, these are a great pair of headphones and they are totally worth the money!

These stopped working on one side; the leather started coming off! We
Sent them to Apple to fix; they accused us of third party tampering which did NOT happen and they sent them back in worse condition then they were when we sent them and now they are completely unusable. The warranty needs to be honored! It has not even been a year!

My wife uses these every time she goes to the gym - this is the first pair of expensive headphones that she is actually willing to use. Great battery life and works flawlessly with her iPhone. She is very pleased with the sound quality and it does a great job playing that hideous hip hop crap she listens to. Other reviews are luke-warm on this model but I can't agree with them - it's great value for money.

it s the first time purchase an on-ear headphones so can not compare with other products. I have it for around 2 months now, sound quality is a bit above average, It has plenty of bass. like other Beats products, quality looks good. The battery life amazed me, 1 hour charge and I use it for 4-5 days, 10hrs/day. The range is pretty far, more than 50 yards I still have good connection. The only thing bothers me is that it hurts my ears after around 1 hour of using. I tried to stretch it by put it over a few book, then use hair dryer to heat it up, leave it over night. It helps quite a lot.

I bought these for my hubby as a graduation present since the ones he had were the wired ones. Gave it to him for graduation and he originally didn't even use them for about a month. So, about 2 months after purchasing them the cover on the ear portion began to come apart. The thread just started to unthread and now you can see the cushion part of the ear. He doesn't even use them anymore. I am very disappointed as these headphones are not cheap and this was his graduation present for getting his Masters!

I got these for a trip and I still love them. They work very well and match my phone. They have a case so I can keep the cord and charger all together. They are adjustable and easy to set up. Noise quality is really great. These are not noise canceling ones but they block out noise well. They turn off in MN cold if you do Bluetooth but work just fine with the cord. There are many color options too.

The biggest quality these headphones have is by far how convenient they are and how easily they connect to an iPhone. They also look very good and the sound quality on these headphones is all right as long as you aren't expecting too much. The controls are also subtle and easy to reach.
However, I cannot recommend this product. The biggest problem with them is how fragile they are. After only six months of casual use, substantial damage is visible. Particularly on the headband, which lacks cushioning and tears very quickly. The other problem is the price. You can find headphones that accomplish the same job for about half the price when looking at brands like Sennheiser or AudioTechnica.
This product seems to be aimed at younger people looking for good looking and convenient headphones. I recommend that you save your money and look elsewhere for headphones that look just as good, sound just as good and are far cheaper.

Birthday present for my 15 year old, he absolutely loves them. I tried them myself and the sound quality is amazing. Couple of quick points:
1. do not have the audio cable plugged in when trying to turn on or setup Bluetooth. The cable needs to be left out in order to do that.
2. if you do use the audio cable, the 90 degree elbow end goes into the audio device and the straight end goes into the headphones. otherwise you will only get sound out of one side.
We had a couple issues initially, but that is only because we didn't follow the above two points. After figuring those out, the headphones work great. Great sound and decent comfort. Easy to setup.

I am constantly wearing headphones and wanted to switch it up by getting a pair of over the ear wireless headphones. I've been looking into getting Beats for a while and was excited to try these out!

1. I love the look of them! Thought I'd look hideous in over the ear wireless headphones but they're super cute and look great.

2. I love the optional cord to plug into devices (not the charger). Provides a nice option if you want to use that!
