3. They're kind of comfy. Not the most comfortable I've ever experienced but decent. Maybe it adds to a little discomfort with the fact that I have multiple ear piercings that perhaps are a little smushed with these style of headphones.

4. The sound quality is AWESOME! So great.

First off let me say that when they are not broken, they are excellent headphones. Sound quality, battery life, range, all of that is great. The problem is they are not durable at all. The first pair I owned, I had to send back to the manufacturer after 6 months due to the battery that all of a sudden stopped charging. It was under warranty so they were replaced. 9 months later the right headphone stopped working but because it was past their 1 year limited warranty (from purchase date) there wasn't anything I could do. I ended up giving them a second chance and buying a second pair, which lasted a little over a year until one side of the headphones (they are expandable) came clean off the headset. For $250 dollars I expect them to last longer than a year. I would suggest going with a different companies product unless you are comfortable replacing these every 12-18 months. All in all its been 28 months since I bought my first pair and now I need to buy a third set of headphones, it will not be from Beats.

Broke after a year. Nothing weird, just wouldn’t turn on one day. Sent them into apple for 130$ for service. After hours of dealing with the service department, they told me I “made product modifications” and they won’t fix them for the 130. These have never left the office. Essentially was accused of being some sort of bedroom hacker with my headphones? Stunningly ridiculous. They told me they’d fix them for $369. Not sure if they’re aware how much they are new? The whole experience is insulting, I won’t be buying more beats products.

I loved this product and gifted it to my wife for her birthday. Its been 5 months and she has barely used these. In the starting she mentioned that it gives her pain in the ear lobes, but i said may be she is not used to headphones so it takes time adjusting. Now she started back and has got a permanent pain in the lobes that hurts her in her day to day activities specifically sleeping as the ears touch he pillow. She has stopped using it now and this product is a waste for me. I want to return it back and need my refund but amazon will not entertain it now. It has created medical issues for my wife and the product is still almost new here. I invested money here and i m really really disappointed with the quality.

Full disclosure. I am an MPow guy that is very satisfied with the quality over my wireless headset. That said, I could not pass up on the deal during Amazon Prime Day. I got this headset for 55% off normal cost and have not been disappointed with my purchase. Very impressed by this headset. Mind you, I was the guy that would never spend $300+ on a pair of premium wireless headphones. At $146 you can't go wrong. ;)

Bought these over three years ago and use mostly for travel and when I'm walking.
Had to take them to get replaced a little over a year ago because they stopped holding a charge and apple replaced when they could not repair. Well now the same thing is happening with the replacement. Couldn't get 2 years out of either head phone and since the one I have is a replacement no further warranty.

Really disappointed. When my wife first used these, running outdoors, they only lasted 5 minutes then shut down. She fully charged and tried again and once again, they stopped working after 5 minutes. Amazon replaced and the new pair is doing the same thing. I thought I was buying top-of-the-line equipment. By the way, the sound is good until they shut down. Honestly, I wouldn't buy these if you live up north where the outdoor temperature falls below 32 degrees.

Great product, until it stops working. 7 months use and no sound out of one side. Ear pads are also ripping away from frame and just look like material is crumbling.
Still under warranty, so we will see the fix they offer. Will update. At this point, not worth the price we paid, wouldn't buy again.

Shockingly poor quality materials and subpar construction for a premium priced product from Beats (and Apple). The sound is solid - although they should get louder in my opinion - but after just a handful of months of "light use" they are literally falling apart. There are two places where the adhesive has worn off and the components are separating from each other. Keep in mind, I'm not some punk kid who doesn't care for his stuff, I'm a 40-year-old man who absolutely babies my electronics!

The first Beats Solo3 received did not work. They would not go wireless nor would they fully work while plugged in. They had many issues. Amazon immediately sent a replacement as I packaged and sent the return item. The replacement head phones were as expected and worked great! My son has enjoyed hours of listening time in the few days he has had them. The battery is amazing and he loves the sound and feel of the headphones. A definite recommend.

I like this product very much. I have to say when I saw the packaging it made me realize how high the standards were. The unboxing experience was top notch and couldn’t ask for better. The first thing I notice when I put these headphones on was that the earmuffs were really soft and comfortable. Then I paired these up to my iPhone and I couldn’t even imagine the simplicity apple has created to pair these beats to a device. Next I played some music. It was very high quality and they were better than any of the headphones I’ve had before, the highs and lows were very balanced. And do not worry about these being counterfeit because I was worried when I purchased them but when I paired the beats there was proof of the W1 chip because of the simple pairing. The battery life on this is also remarkable I didn’t have to charge these for weeks till they were dead. Overall I really recommend picking these up, bye and I hope u like your beats. :)

I bought these Beats headphones because they were on sale, and because I thought "It's been a while since I had beats, maybe I should give them a second chance." I should not have. I may be biased since I own high quality headphones, I have Bose QuietComfort 35ii and Sony WH-1000XM3s. I was expecting sound quality maybe just slightly below these with no active noise canceling since they were just on-ear and what I got was far below my expectations.

Sound Quality: 2/5
By no means are these the worse headphones I've ever listened to, but they are the worst headphones I have ever listened to at this price point. The trebles are just meh and that's the best part of these headphones. The mids sound like you're listening to someone else's party down the street or you're listening to someone else's music through a wall. It's atrociously bad and this is the worst part of the headphone. The bass is actually okay... until you have both bass and another range of sound playing at the same time. The bass quality is nice, and these really boost bass but you sacrifice washing out the rest of the song into a muddle mess and hearing nothing but slapping bass. This is fine, if you're a basshead and these headphones are GREAT when I'm listening to a bass-heavy rap song or EDM, but when I want to listen to anything else they're pretty trash.

Appearance: 3/5
These are beats and they look more like a fashion statement than any real headphones. Audiophiles will smirk as you pass by them because they know you paid way more than these are actually worth.

Comfort: 1/5
The clamping force is too hard for anyone to wear comfortably especially compared to what else is on the market for this price point. On top of that the materials used are super uncomfortable. The rubber headband pulls on your hair (and mine's short, I'm in the Marine Corps), the ear cups are stiff and made of some type of pleather probably, and after a half hour of wearing them (ONLY A HALF HOUR!!) I don't want to continue listening to these headphones since they push on my ears uncomfortably, grip my head and pull my hair (I'm not that into BDSM, thank you).

Ease of Access (iOS): 3/5
Ease of Access (everything else): 1/5

Connecting to an iPhone or iPad is a breeze, just turn the headphones on and bam you're connected for the most part. Sometimes it's a little finnicky. In comparison, the airpods have a much smaller form factor, better latency and better range.

Connecting to any other device is like trying to fight your mom; you'll probably win, but is it worth it? Definitely not. These will connect to your other devices, but in order to stop it from connecting to my iPad even when I had told my iPad to forget these headphones I had to take my iPad to another room and turn on these headphones outside with the device I wanted. Definitely cumbersome.

For full price of $299.99 these are just not worth it. Even for the discounted price of $160, they just aren't worth it.
Amazon has plenty of other well-priced headphones on the market...

For bassheads: Skullcandy Crusher Wireless ($120)
For flat EQ but good sound: Bose QuietComfort 35ii ($350)
For the best acoustic sound: Sony WH-1000XM3 ($350)
Best sound on a budget: Audio-Technica ATH-M50x (on sale for $130, but usually $150)

In summary, if you want convenient iOS headphones, just buy the airpods. If this is you're first time venturing into the expensive headphone market, I hope this review helped you move away from these headphones. I really don't know who these are for except people who were previously fans of the Beats line. If anything though, I think their sound quality has further degraded from when Beats was partnered with monster headphones. I hope this review helped!

These are AWESOME! As a Mom, I am typically not a “name brand” kind of person. These were a gift from my husband and really a splurge, but I absolutely love them. Doing laundry, dishes, and other housework is much more enjoyable listening to music and these do not fall off my head like other headphones and earbuds I have owned in the past. So any Moms out there who aren’t sure about these, just go ahead and make the purchase. High quality, easy to connect, and well worth the money!

love my headphones and if it gets soiled, I use a wipe or a damp soapy rag to clean it and it is a good as new. It cancels out everything and the battery life is as promised, I listened to my books when I’m cleaning the house, running errands, and doing choirs and I’m never worried that the battery is going to fail me. For how I use it you would think I would have to charge it daily, but I don’t. It’s a great product.

This is my second pair of Beats and both stopped functioning after about 18 months. My last pair would not turn off. I did a factory reset that worked but now it won’t turn on. I’ve tried every trick known to the Internet to no avail. Beats updater says that my firmware is up to date and that my Beats are functioning. Obviously not. On a good note, the battery life and sound quality are both great.

I loved them for everything except for comfort. After less than 30 minutes, I continually had bad ear and jaw pain. I could feel my ears throbbing while wearing them. I tried moving them around and stretching them out to no success, so I'll be returning them.
I'm definitely a believer in everything else about them, so I hope they make future iterations that'll work for me!

I like the sound quality, the lightness, and I’m pleasantly surprised by the comfort level. I have previously owned Beats Solo 2’s Wireless and they did hurt my ears after wearing them awhile. I’ve worn these for hours straight with no issues. The bass is sufficient and the Bluetooth connection with my iPhone is flawless! I’d say these were a great purchase at 129 dollars during the recent Cyber Monday event.

These are HORRIBLE! I have gotten 2 different pairs for my fiancé. Both pairs will not hold a charge. When they do charge, the die very quickly. Disconnect from phone for no reason. Cannot even get to turn on anymore when they are fully charged. These are a waste of money and should be fraud for what the represent compare to what they provide to you. Two different pairs have done the same thing. It's the product in general. bad quality. Do not waste your money on these.

Pros:
1- looks amazing
2- Loud sound
3- fair bass

Cons:
1- No Next/Previous track buttons.
2- Ears get too hot at gym because of the leather. I would really prefer if they made another sport line that contains cushion instead.

Concentrate on the performance & comfort. The only difference between Solo 2 & 3 is battery which doesn’t make sense

If you are a bass hunter or like dubstep this is for you otherwise look for better quality headphones low range is non existent or muffled and medium is there but super heavy on bass and the wireless works well but not long range enough the earpads are the same from other models so they will ware out better to buy replacements now or higher quality ones. You are buying the name not good headphones. Decent battery life.

My nephews wanted these, and they love them. They sound okay to me, but I'd honestly look elsewhere if you want a high-quality, comfortable pair of headphones.

The bluetooth and battery life are the real pluses on these. The battery lasts forever, they charge pretty quickly, and the bluetooth has a really good range. The sound tends to be a bit bass-heavy and possibly muddy, and I don't know how comfortable they would be over a long session. I tried them out only for a few minutes and could only go off of my immediate impressions.

Depending on your genre preferences, these may be suitable. For me, I would look elsewhere.

I went through every process detailed to check whether they were real or not after I got them on a too-good-to-be-true Prime Day deal. From everything I can tell they are, and they register with the Beats Software Updater.

These headphones sound really good like other beats headphones I have had. The problem with these headphones is how uncomfortable they are. If you are only using them for 30 minutes or so they are just fine. Anything more than that your ears will start hurting more and more. I don't know why they went with on ear headphones pads instead of over ear headphones. The studio headphones I have are over ear and they can be worn for hours without any discomfort.

I really enjoy the convenience of these wireless headphones. They're easy to use and fit comfortably over my ears. They're not too heavy, which I was concerned about because I plan to run in them, and the collapsible arms are helpful for storage. In terms of sound quality, I don't feel that they're especially better than other good quality headphones, but they're good. The sound quality certainly isn't compromised at all. Whether intentional or not, they do have some noise cancellation effect also which I appreciate. Overall, pleased with my purchase.

The problem with this product is not the quality but the user unfriendliness of it’s design.
You don’t even know if it’s off or on, because there is no signal... either the design is flawed or the product I received is defective.
Having some kind light that indicates it’s on will help... per the user manual it says the fuel gauge will light white... the product I got only shows the lights when it’s only plugged to usb...

I just ordered and received these headphones today (same day delivery with Prime). I'll start by saying they are authentic Beats (Fulfilled by Amazon). I purchased the protection plan just in case. That being said, i'm listening to music with these headphones as I write this review, and they are perfect.

They'll be gym tested tomorrow, but based on the fit, I don't anticipate any issues. A great first impression.

Build: 4 - Lightweight and sturdy construction
Comfort: 5 - Snug fit...stays on my head, and they fit comfortably
Sound 5 - The sound is great. I'm no audio expert, but it offers deep, rich sounds

My granddaughter loved them. She plays the piano and can hook them up to her keyboard and listen to songs as she plays them back on the piano without bothering the rest of her family. The sound seems to be awesome and it was just the pick of Christmas. I bought a blue pair for her brother and he loves his as well. His were the Solo2 and there is not a lot of difference between the Solo2 or the Solo3...

These are awesome. I love everything about them, but mostly the Mickey design; however, I also happened to get my son a pair of Bose, and I would definitely rethink my purchase no matter how much I love Mickey Mouse.

Bingo! As an older fella I haven’t been impressed with all the young studs walking around with these but, in desperation, I ordered a pair and have never looked back. I like them. They sound terrific and young beautiful women are walking past me without noticing a darned thing. Battery life? I’ve had them for a month now and STILL haven’t used the charging cable.

The sound quality is amazing and I love it, but only use it for less than 2 months and the sound is not playing in the right ear. I expected a higher quality especially since this is not a cheap headset. I expected more from beats, my husband have the pro and my son the solo. This solo3 is the only one not working. I'm very disappointed and sad since I really enjoyed it.

I order the headphones thinking they would do me justice on my deployment in Kuwait but I was wrong like way wrong. The first month they were perfect in every aspect of the word but out of nowhere one side went out and would barely work since. Two more months passed and then they just stopped working all together and since the warranty was with a 3rd party it just left me with broken headphones in the middle of my deployment. I will never buy anything like this from amazon again and amazon was my trusted source till now. So be careful what you buy and trust and believe these are trash.

90 days after purchasing the material began to tear away from the head piece. I took it to the Apple store and they replaced them only to have it happen within 90 days again. Warranty is now up and I refuse to order another pair or pay for them to be fixed. The quality does NOT justify the price and I’ll NEVER order another pair.

Power button stopped working after a little over a year, which after some extensive googling seems to be a very common problem with beats headphones. They were decent quality in terms of audio, not completely sound cancelling, but I liked them. If I’m honest I bought them mainly for their battery life and their appearance. Sad to have lost them, which I guess indicates something in their favor. But angry enough not to want to buy them again.
After only 6 months there is a short and they won’t work. This is our second pair of beats. The first pair quit working just over a year old.

They sound really good. I haven't tested a bunch of brands, but I know Beats get really good reviews. The only reason I don't give them five stars is this: After about 8 months of use, these wireless headphones are starting to do what my wired Beats did -- the foam is starting to peel away on the ears. It's not the end of the world....I'll probably order some replacements when they come all the way off. But this issue keeps them from being a five-star product.

It’s a bit base heavy, as it is designed to do, but I feel my music sounds so much better with it streaming from my iPhone.
I prefer it to the Grados my husband owns....
Headphones sit securely on my head even when running on the elliptical and working out. Very comfortable without feeling too snug. No headaches from wearing them for hours on end. Yeahy!

Was looking to upgrade from my original solo’s and I’m incredibly pleased with the Solo3’s. These headphones are so aesthetically pleasing! I got the Satin Silver color and I am so happy with how crisp they look. These are more comfortable than the original Solos and seem to be constructed in a more solid manner (I threw in a picture of my old white Solos for comparison, which might I add lasted me SEVEN years without trouble, hoping for the same longevity with the Solo3’s). The Solo3’s sound awesome and the pairing capabilities are lightining fast due to the w1 chip that allows for speedy pairing with Apple devices. I will update once I’ve had these headphones for longer to report on their durability and battery life. Extremely happy with my purchase!

Item was listed as “NEW”. I received it and it wasn’t sealed, had greasy finger prints all over the headset, there was a beat up LG charger to replace the original one, the case was missing, and the instructions were missing as well. Make not want to ever order a used item even though I didn’t order one this time

These headphones are really nice. The bass isn't too crazy but enough where it doesn't disort it. The sound overall is pretty decent. They connect easy and have impressive battery life. They last about 2 days without disconnecting them once. I would recommend these but make sure you read the specs before you buy if your looking for super loud bass headphones

I love this headphones, they connect so easy to any device, ipad, TV, phone, and the sound is just amazing. I wanted this headphones because I've been doing binural meditation and I wanted to cancel any noise. I don't like having anything inside my ear and the tiny succion headphones create some king of pressure on my ears, instead of meditating I keep focusing on how my ears feel. I got my headphones on sale and although I wanted another color (whcih was not on sale) they are woth the price!! Best of all is that I can watch tv late without bodering anybody.

Much, much too expensive for what you get. My 11 yr old son insisted on these because of the brand name. The sound quality and build quality aren't nearly as good as what you get for this price from Bose, Sennheiser or Grado. The plastic circle behind the driver pops off every week or two because the plastic tabs holding it together don't fit tight enough. Bluetooth connection is pretty solid to both Apple and Android devices.

I love the headphones in general but have found that after 30 minutes of use and they make my ears hurt. They push against my piercings into my cartilage to be quite sore. I have attempted to get replacement ear cushions in hopes of getting some a little bigger but if you change ear cushions then it voids warranty. They also do not offer replacement ear cushions from beats. So in my case they have not been worth the money I spent on them. I attempted to allow my 11 year old to use them and he states it hurts his ears also. Might be just us might be a issue for others as well. I would go with the studio headphones if you getting them over the ear.

I purchase Beats Solo 3 brand new sealed but after when i received i noticed item it was open box and no sealed possible from manufacturer when i open i saw the quality of the item is so cheap look like fake or someone use before and return to amazon i go to apple store and purchase this from them and compered together it was lot different , amazon buyer be ware make sure receive the item brand new and sealed not open box

I have had these headphones for almost 2 weeks now and I love them! They are able to connect to all of my devices via bluetooth with no issues and they hold a charge for a long time. I use them for hours on end and haven't had a problem with the battery getting low or dying on me. The sound is also great. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is because they are a bit tight on my ears and it starts to hurt after about an hours use. I ordered the gloss black which I feared may look cheap or leave fingerprint marks but it actually looks very nice in person and doesn't get dirty easily.

These headphones are awesome for working out in a crowded gym– noise cancelling enough to block out all the other machines without having to turn up my music to dangerously high volumes, big enough to signal “don’t talk to me”, and adjustable so they don’t fall off my head when I’m doing abs or something (a big problem for me, I have a tiny and weird shaped head). Plus, the matte black is very pretty (in my opinion). Plus, the automatic connection from the W1 chip to my iPhone is a MAJOR bonus over the older models; otherwise, I can’t tell much of a difference from my old Solo2s. If you don’t have an iPhone, maybe save your money and go for an older model, but if you do, then the W1 is an amazing investment. Overall, I love em!

Great sound, comfortable headphones and great price! All wireless! Great color and was waiting to get these when I could afford it, but these are $110 less than I have seen elsewhere so became my birthday present to myself! Convenient with a carry case. I would have made the zipper on the carry case open wider, but that is my only complaint. Even has a carabiner to snap it on something for safe traveling.

Bought as a gift and my husband LOVES them! He likes to listen to house music so the bass is a huge deal. He could not stop talking about how incredible they are. While not deafeningly loud to the wearer, people around can hear the music. So I wouldn't recommend wearing them at a high volume in a library or someplace where you need to be quiet. The sound quality is superb though.

Very very VERY disappointed! After less than 6 months of using them (and I bought two pairs!) both are:
- Having problems since day one to connect through Bluetooth
- Going away and coming back sound quality
- Need to be charged for over 24hrs to work for 2hrs straight
- Disconnecting in the middle of work online meetings and webinars
- Currently, both pairs are NOT WORKING!!!

I am utterly disappointed, upset and I would never EVER recommend this product! I have been THE BIGGEST FAN of Dr. Beats and the products over the years but this has been super disappointing, especially buying them for Christmas gifts and never dropping them or doing anything that would harm the product or sound....
I want the seller to contact me immediately!

Liked them, sound was good, but they crapped out. No power. No lights. Charge was good while it lasted. Bought a new battery, but it didn’t fix them.

Super expensive for headphones that only made it 2 years. And, I really babied them. I have other Bluetooth cans and speakers (JBL’s and Mpow’s) that are much less expensive that are still working great. Surprisingly great sound on the cheaper ones also.

So, everything came great and it was good quality. I just got a headache from wearing them because it was too tight on my head and the pressure changed in my ears. If pressure and band size isn't an issue for you then this should work great but if you are prone to headaches the pressure of these headphones won't be for you.

I'm a huge Disney nut & wanted these soooo bad but didn't want to pay $300. So when they finally went on sale during Black Friday deals, I was super excited!! At first they great & then after about an hour, they became really uncomfortable on my ears. It felt as though they were clamping my ears down to my head like a vice grip. I tried adjusting them, taking out my earrings or just moving them around in general. The only thing that helped was taking them off. I was so disappointed and had no choice but to return them. They were no good to me if I couldn't wear them for more than an hour at a time.

Battery power is phenomenal.
Two weeks without charging. Everyday use. The only down fall is the case in which the headphones come. It is so small and won’t protect headphones but that can be easily replaced by buying a bigger/hard case which there’s a lot to choose from here at amazon. Worth the price for the quality and duration of battery!!!

This is my second pair of Beats Headphones my first wireless version. They are perfect!! I fly all over the US almost every week. They connect to my ipad and phone effortlessly. The sound is rich and you can hear everything. Even thought they are not touted as "noise cancelling headphones" I find that they do a very good job at keeping the airplane noises to a minimum. I recommend these headphones.

Can’t say enough about the battery life. Bought them for my 12 year old who consistently is hooked up to wired headphones. He uses them for hours during the day and hasn’t had to charge them in 3 weeks. They still have 53% battery life left. Specifications say 70hr battery life but I really didn’t expect it. Only downfall is, the case provided with them is a soft case and not very protective so I would definitely consider spending an additional $10 on a hard case for them.

Everything was great—worked just as described, looks good, excellent sound quality and very comfortable.....and then if got cold. Not crazy cold—it’s just 25F —just below freezing. They just shut off. Very sad as I planned to use them for winter hikes and cross country skiing....I would give it a 5 star rating if I lived where it was warmer all year.

Beats Solo3 Wireless do not disappoint at any aspect. Great sound, long battery life, easy to use, very comfortable, looks awesome. We are price sensitive buyers and we would like to get our money's worth. These headphones are a good value-for-money purchase. We gave this as a gift to our son and he loves it! It's really hard to get these out of his hands and I "borrow" them whenever I get a chance. I am looking at getting a pair for myself, too.

My biggest complaint is that for an iOS device there’s no iOS App. You have to go into Widgets and add Battery in order to see the level. Another issue is it should either charge via lightning or USB c cable, not micro USB. I understand it was bought from someone, but they could have changed the way it charges to be in line with Apple products. Other than that, I like the sound very much. The price was very reasonable. The battery life is awesome,

Very uncomfortable headphones, super tight and rigid. After just 2-3 hours use on plane, my ears hurts like hell and I have to take it off. By comparison bose headphones are so much more comfortable you don’t even feel like they were there, I regret deeply trying to save some money and not getting the Bose instead.

I was a little worried about if I would be able to use these headphones for all my gym activities, but no longer! The color is amazing, bass and sound quality are perfect, and the Bluetooth connection (including how far you can walk away from your phone) work great for me. I ran in these and they didn't even budge. People were talking about the plastic on these, but the quality seemed great to me. Nice and light as well which I can appreciate in the gym. Love these headphones.

These lasted less than 3 months! Do not buy these. The quality of the product is obviously lacking. The number of people that report them breaking says a lot. For everyone that comes back and writes a negative review there are probably 10 that have problems. They work great initially, but simply do not last anywhere near long enough to merit the cost.

1-Does not sync well with my Android phone, there is a constant clicking noise when linked ith blue tooth, and when linked with wire, sound is only in one ear. Ok for podcasts not for music.
2-works great with my tablets, no complaints
3-headphones too small, does not cover entire ear, sits on top of my ear
Tengo tres meses que los compre y ya no sirven me salieron de muy mala calidad no recomiendo que los compres😡😡

I love these headphones. I wear them to the gym regularly and use them for work conference calls. What blows my mind is I've only had to charge them maybe 4x in the several months that I've had them! Amazing product. The only negative is that they become a little uncomfortable after about 40 min esp if you're wearing earrings. But most of them do.

Super easy to sync with my iPhone and iPad. Good quality sound for a wireless set. The range and battery life are amazing. I can leave my iPhone in my locker at the gym and roam the whole building during my workout without losing signal. The only negative is that they make my ears a little warm when I wear them while exercising.

The sound quality is amazing and the battery duration is very long lasting.

I loved mine while they lasted. Now only one side works when I connect it through bluetooth. The head pad that it has is going to come off really fast after you use them for a couple of months.

As people have pointed out, it's just dissapointing that you're paying a premium price and you're not quite what you expect.

Bought these for my Wife - she loved them so much I bought another pair (not pink!) for myself and I have to say that overall, when paired with iPhone, they are amazing. Extreme battery life. Fast charging and sync very nicely.

I did have to buy earphone covers to use them for running though as they have a moisture shutoff that triggers if you sweat a lot.

I travel a ton for work and rely on headphones that will reduce the white noise of the planes engines when attempting to watch movies/shows or listen to music. These headphones were great at achieving that and super great in instantly connecting with my apple products. Two stars were taken off for general build quality as the connection point for the right ear broke upon adjustment after just a few months. Would consider buying new model if build issues were resolved.

bought for 13 year old son for his birthday. This was the best price I could find after looking around online and in local stores. I wasn't entirely sure my son would like the gold color, but he was thrilled by them and they're much more fun than the basic black. He's had them almost two months with lots of daily use. I like that they come with a case to take them along with us in the car or traveling.

Beats delivers amazing quality in their solo 3 wireless headphones. Long lasting battery life and quick charges allows for tons of listening time. High quality sound and a beautiful Disney design makes these great for any music and Disney fan.

Headphones worked fine until sliding function broke. We used tape to hold it in place. Sent the product in and they refused to honor the warranty because applying tape was an "unauthorized modification". The tech couldn't care less and I've heard this is commonplace for Apple. They have your money...and guess what...they will gladly send you a new pair at "market value" which is currently $40 more than I paid for them. They broke within 2 months of ownership. Guess my son will have no headphones for his virtual school he is forced to attend. Thanks Apple for your compassion and commitment to reliability!

I was very hesitant on buying Beats because normally they're heavy on the bass and muffled on the treble. Not with the Solo3. These were extremely well rounded in the Bass/ Treble. Don't get me wrong, these headphones have a lotta Bass at a high volume and the treble is adjusted acoustically to sound normal and not muffled. At a low volume, the treble jumps out at you with a crystal clear sound and the bass is adjusted to a low roar.

The weight is pretty well distributed. They sit pretty well on your head with no extreme tightness on the ears or the head. Yes, they sit on the ears instead of over the ears. I didn't realize this until I received them. I have used some like this in the past and didn't care for the feel or the sound of them. Once I tried on the Solo3, I could tell this wasn't the same story like in the past. The leather padding is great. A pillow - like feel on the ears makes these comfortable to wear for hours. Adjusting them is very easy also. Just pull , right above the headphone, up or down to fit your ear height. Also the headphones fold inward for easy storage.

Battery usage is definitely a plus on these Beats! Their claims that it last about 40 hours is right on target. The first time I used them, the battery lasted about 38 hours but after I charged them it went as long as 42 hours on a single charge so go figure. The 10 minute fast charge does last a good 3 hours so that is definitely a plus in my book.

As for looks, you can't go wrong. Typical Beats good looks, just packaged in a smaller size. I went with the flat or matte black. I don't care for the "fingerprint" look so I didn't go with the glossy black because reviewers say it is a fingerprint magnet.

Connection is a breeze with Bluetooth and even better if you have the iPhone 7. If you don't have the iPhone 7 or iOS 10+ then Bluetooth connectivity is as usual: turn on the Bluetooth on your device and look for Solo3. For IPhone 7 or iOS 10+ just turn on the Bluetooth and connect it once and your iPhone will remember the Solo3. Now, the next time you turn on your Beats headphones it will automatically connect to your iPhone.

The Beats Solo3 package came with its own storage bag, USB A-to-USB micro-B for charging and a male to male 3.5mm cord to use the headphones without the use of the Bluetooth.

Not sure what the previous buyers received but I just got these Solo3 headphones December 2019 and they are phenominal! I was nervous ordering them after reading the previous reviews, but I’m SO glad I ignored them in this case. The packaging is legitimate and everything that is supposed to come with them comes with them. The sound is A++ and the noise cancellation is perfect! Buy them! They are worth it!

These aren’t advertised to be noise-canceling, so I’m not sure why I’m asked to rate that aspect. My only complaint is that the ear cups hurt my ears over time; I’m not sure why they’re smaller than the Beats and Beats 2 I also own. I love the sound and the wireless feature - holds a charge forever!

I use my beats every day to listen to music, podcasts, and audiobooks.

You do have to break them in though, they hurt really bad for the first few days after only an hour or two of wearing and I have a small head.

They also get stretched out and then become too loose, so I can't use them to work out or really do anything but sit or walk while wearing. I don't even trust wearing them while washing dishes because they'll slip forwards off my face.

I love my beats but I wish they were designed to fit better.

I got these things as a gift from my wife last Christmas. By June the black cover around the ear piece began to fall off. Called in and covered under warranty and replaced no problem. Fast forward 6 months doing same exact thing but warranty no longer applies after they are replaced once. Definitely won’t buy this brand ever again. Shortly after the foam wore off they completely quit working on the right side. Technically $200 for 6 months of use

These Solo3 will not disappoint! If you're looking for headphones with crippling bass these ain't it. However, the balance of sound from high, low and mid is amazing! The bass doesn't drown out the others, nor do the others cancel the bass effect. Just a well rounded pair of headphones. Love them!

I didn't read the reviews before purchasing these, but after hitting the purchase button I decided to go through some and see if there was a common issue. Well, I kept seeing that people were reporting getting fakes/refurbished products. So I became alarmed. They were same day delivery so when I got home and saw the box I was nervous I was sent fakes or refurbished headphones. Well after doing thorough research and watching several youtube videos, I discovered they were in fact real. I have had them for a week now and my only complaint is that they are a bit tight over my ears where my glasses are, but I suppose that's my bad for wearing glasses. Otherwise, they hold a charge forever, my last beats (purchased new at Best Buy) only lasted maybe 6-8 hours. These can go a few days which is nice. The sound quality is good, though they are not noise cancelling. I didn't need that since I mainly use these in my office at work, and I want to be able to hear if someone knocks at my door or walks in. Overall, pretty good!

Bought this for my son. Who said the sound is excellent. The ear muffs "just" covers the ears. but this is fine watching my son who plays D1 HS Basketball he'll take this off and leave around his neck. Because the ear muffs are small it doesn't get in the way under his chin. We tested the range some bit. No problem about 30ft. away. Sound and stream was still excellent. of course you'll always have the disance limitations set forth with Bluetooth tech specifications.

They were beautiful and great sound but hurt my ears. I ended up returning these and getting a really nice pair of off brand, over the ear headphones and they are much more comfortable than these and have just as equally good sound quality and noise cancellation. It was very disappointing these didn’t work out.

Pros: These headphones have great quality sound.
Cons: they smash my ears so after wearing them for any period of time my ears are sore. Overall they are not comfortable to wear. Additionally the case that they come in is ever so slightly bigger than the headphones so they have to be put in the case perfectly to fit.

These are great quality headphones. I have owned a bunch of Beats headphones in the past but this is my first wireless pair. The bluetooth function works great and they can be converted to wired headphones just by plugging in the included wire. Sound clarity is amazing along with the bass. The only issue I have with these, as with all solo's, is that after having them on your head for an extended time they will hurt your ears/ make them sore. I would opt for he studios if you can.

Really happy with the product. The only downside is that they sent the wrong color ( it was supposed to be gold and they are rose gold) unfortunately I leave to see my family next week and could not return. They are a gift for a boy so it’s kind of sad. Other than that, they work great!

For $200 I expected these to last longer than 3 weeks! Within a 3 week time span the sound went completely out in one ear and was off and on in the other ear, by week 5 there was no sound coming out of the headset at all! They were a birthday gift to my son and I have not been able to get them replaced or repaired, so I just wasted $200. I will never trust Beats ever again!

I bought these headphones for my sons birthday last November. He loved them. Couldn’t be happier. About 2 weeks ago he started having trouble with the right headphone. Sometimes he could hear out of it and sometimes he couldn’t. It finally gave out. He was so sad and I was frustrated because the 12-month warranty is about to expire. I contacted the company I purchased it from on amazon and they were wonderful. Answered my email right away and they should be sending replacement headphones. I’m
Hoping they come before my sons birthday. He will be so excited and happy. Follow up review to follow once they send them and we receive them. :)

I ordered these beats because I could no longer wear my airpods with my new tragus piercing. The sound quality is great and the battery seems to last a really long time. My biggest complaint is that these are super uncomfortable for my ears. they hold on tightly and it’s like my ears are sore when I take them off. If it weren’t for that, I’d give them 5 stars. The color is nice and they seem durable.

Love my beats. Sounds great, easy to connect to my S8 phone or iPod. Battery last long. Charges fast. I use it during my train ride to work or workouts. My only regret is getting them in silver where the earpiece is white. They get dirty and you have to be careful cleaning them without damaging it. Otherwise, it's a great product.

I'm not going to delve into the subjective territory of sound quality. I will say that the sound is rich and performs better than expected (especially given Beats' history of emphasizing bass). The battery life is stellar and Bluetooth connection has been impeccable with amazing range and only rare hiccups. My one complaint is that it is a snug fit on my ears: after 1-2 hours, they actually start to hurt my ears a little.

Bought these for my son who wrestles. He rocked these before 87 individual matches to get pumped up. No complaints. No issues with sweat. Great batter life. He's completely 100% content. 3 star on noice cancelling, but they aren't advertised as such. Eveything else is great.

Just got my Beats in the mail and I am absolutely in love with them!!! Sound is awesome, feel great on, love the matte black, brand new wrapped in plastic and everything inside was wrapped nicely as well. These are not reused or fake, they are the real deal! SO happy with my purchase!

I waited so long to buy the headphones. I tested them at an Apple Store and was amazed by the sound fidelity and bass. Even my wife was impressed. But I wasn’t in a good financial status, so I skipped the purchase at the time. That was last year. I heard about Amazon Prime days and decided to wait. The Solo 3 was the 1st thing that popped out when searching for electronic devices. And for $139 this time I would not let it pass away. Simply the best headphones that I have bought. And let me tell you I have bought many.

Good quality sound, looks nice, but cheap quality. However the first one I got malfunctioned with virtually no physical damage. I got a replacement. However the replacement broke a few months later again with no physical damage. I am disappointed. The headphones don't work wirelessly under 0 degrees centigrade (32 F) so if you live in an area that gets cold in the winter expect to bring the wire.

Let’s start with, I love Mickey. I definitely waited for the price to drop because (sorry, not sorry) Beats just isn’t worth it. The Mickey print is a beautiful matte. I really adore them but of course the sound quality/clarity just isn’t there.
If you want great headphones for a decent price, please go with Vmoda! My cross fade 100 beat $300 Beats headphones.

I got these on Prime Day for a discounted price. I am not a headphone connoisseur but I was looking for something that was a little more suited for the office than my wireless in ear headphones I use at the gym. I have a loud intern that sits next to me who is the life of the office and needed something to block the noise out. It works. A little too well sometimes. I jump out of my skin at least 4 times per day when someone touches my shoulder or I see them out of the corner of my eye. Works for me.

I've been a content user of corded, over-the-ear-headphones forever, always barely tolerating the cord getting hung up on my office chair several times a day... I've also been a bit of a snob about the Beats brand, shunning the brand hype and the expense. Not sure what put me over the edge, but I couldn't be happier that I made the leap/cut the cord. These headphones are fantastic. Battery life is excellent - I've had them for about 2 months and the battery still is half-charged. Great bluetooth range, superb sound. I use them daily at my desk job and at home (yard work, wood working projects, etc.). The controls on the headset are slick as well.

I love these things because they cancel out loud, obnoxious noises (like your animals whining while you're trying to focus and study for a big test). They are also very comfortable to wear. I've had on-ear headphones in the past that were so tight they gave me a headache. I could wear these all day studying if I needed to!

I was surprised by the solo 3s good sounding. Use them as workout headphones. Not worth 300 but got them on sale and they are good sounding plenty of volume not to bass heavy but got good sound and bass to them. And still using them to work out with no problems. Of course they always go back into the case.

Excellent fit powerful sound I actually gave these to my daughter she wanted some wireless headphones for when she works out at the gym these have met her expectations and more they are very comfortable she said I have tried them on and they are very comfortable with that and the sound is great if you’re looking for the beat sound with the wireless capability then I would recommend these

I really like these headphones overall, the sound quality is good and they're decently noise-isolating. HOWEVER, I've had them only for about a year, and the battery life and their condition has declined significantly. While previously I only had to charge them once a month (with use for HOURS daily) now they barely last a few days. In addition, one of the side hinges is broken, and that side of the headphones doesn't stay collapsed, and will kind of swing out at random. In general, I like these, but please be warned that they probably won't last much more than a year and a half with normal use. Personally, I think they're far too expensive to have declined this quickly.

I bought these in November of 2018. It’s June of 2020 and they are already broken. One ear isn’t working at all and the other if I press on it it will work otherwise it goes in and out and sounds like static. For the price, they should last a lot longer than what they did. Very disappointed.

I bought these head phones precisely for the noise cancellation feature. My spouse has to have the volume so high while watching tv I was in Hope's of being able to cancel out the sound and listen to another device while being able to say in same room as the tv. Did not cancel noise.

Wanted to buy the Wifey a BOSE noise cancelling headphone instead, but she wanted these. Regret not doing it, but I’m a die hard BOSE fan. These are a nice set of headphones though. They produce great sound, not noise cancelling so if your looking for total submersion into the music, get some Noise cancelling headphones. All in all she’s happy.

Five months and one side of the headphones goes out. The product started malfunctioning yesterday. Now, whenever I try to connect to a device wirelessly, one side is cut out. Not to mention the constant audio break up. The cord also stopped working after a month. Very disappointing. What a waste of $230!

I wear these headphones everyday to the gym and have been wearing them for a long time now. the sound quality is still amazing. the battery lasts extremely long and it charges very quick when low. one of the earphone covers just started to come undone but with the amount I have been wearing and sweating in them they still work amazing.

I absolutely love these headphones for my workouts. I previously had ear plugs and they were constantly coming out of my ear whenever I sweat so I would have to frequently stop my workouts to put back and readjust them in my ear which got super annoying when i'm trying to concentrate on burning some fat. I've been using these for about a week now and they are really great, i can focus on my workouts and the sound quality is totally bomb. i won't go into all the specs and technical mumbo jumbo cuz i don't know them, but if you're looking for something that stays put and has good sound quality and long battery life you can't go wrong with these.

I live in NYC, where the temperature at the the winter could be very low. For a couple of days temperature dropped down under 32 deegres Fahrenheit and I have difficulties to use my headphones outside my apartment. After 5 minutes outside, headphones switching off by themself. I can not turn them back on until, I am back to a warmer place for at least 5-10 minutes. I sent a message to Beats by Dre tech support, and I received an answer saying the optimum temperature for using this headphones is above 32 deegres Fahrenheit. So it means that I not gonna be able to use this product through the winter. On my opinion Beats shoul inform customers that they could expect difficulties using this equipment in the cold environment.

I have tried a few different head phones but wanted blue tooth and smaller ear cup size so it didn't look weird while I listed at work. For the price I really dont notice a great sound difference from something like my BOHM headphones at a third of the price. I have glasses and these things kill my ear as they are so tight with no way to loosen them. I would have expect more out of something so pricey.

They were working well the first 2 weeks and then everything went down hill. The sound would start failing in the right ear until it was completely gone and I could only hear from one ear. Then it wouldn’t connect to the Bluetooth on my phone. And after a while I had to call amazon for help on what to do because I had it for a little over a month.

Best wireless headphones hands-down! These are the easiest plug and play headphones ever. Right out of the box, they come with easy to start instructions, how to use the buttons and connect blue tooth. I was up and running in less than 2 minutes. They also fold really well into a case that is included. I'm really happy with the sounds, and they are very much noise-cancelling in my opinion even though I'm not sure it's advertised to be. Very comfortable, long battery life and well worth the money!

They look great. If looks are your thing, grab these. If you don’t really care about looks and sound quality is your thing then you can definitely find something better for this price. That’s the biggest issue with Beats.. Price. But even then, the sound isn’t bad, just not good enough for the price.

Poorly made headphones. While the sound quality and noise cancelation are great, within six months of use the padding cover started coming off. For the amount of money spent on these, that shouldn’t have been an issue. I had knockoffs that lasted years.

First problem may not be 100% Beat's fault, however, they are an Apple product. They don't play nice with Bluetooth. Failure and intermittent connection, dropped connection, both on Apple computers. Maybe not Beat's fault, but they are useless for the intended purpose if unable to establish a reliable Bluetooth connection.
Second problem, they are uncomfortably tight on the ears.
Third, the on/off switch offers no tactile functionality. The headphones must be removed and looked at in order to power on (or off).
The sound quality and noise cancelling are fine, but so is every other brand.

They worked amazing for the first couple months and then I had trouble with Bluetooth connection, the aux cord thing it comes with had a short in it so it sounds static-y with it in PLUS to top it off the right side stopped working on the headphones. I contacted amazon but they said I had to contact the beats support and the repair would cost almost as much as it would to replace the entire headphones. HUNDREDS OF DOLLARS DOWN THE DRAIN.

Love Beats overall, have used the wired ones for a few years. And now have the wireless. I highly recommend. These are perfect for people with smaller features. I’ve tried other over the ear headphones and they are huge and look silly. These are compact and cool. The charge lasts a long time. Read the instructions to figure out the headset controls like volume.

Fantastic headphones that quickly became a staple in my workout routine. I enjoy the moderate noise cancellation they provide. It’s not perfect, but I never needed it to be. It blocks just enough noise to allow for a nap on a plane or to focus on your workout in the gym. I really love these headphones.

I expected much better sound quality for the price. I have bought much less expensive ones that sound better. I only use these to workout. And when I lay down on the bench or on the floor, they are always falling off. Even when I have them completely tightened.

I love the Beats brand. They never fail when it comes to great sound. The quality of these headphones are great. They are very durable. The color is my favorite so that is great too. The battery lasts forever. I usually use these while i'm working out and doing chores around my house and I may have to charge them twice a month. This is my second pair of beats and they are only getting better.

These are my second set of Beats, the first Blue tooth. These are super comfortable, and easy to install on both my iPhone and iPad. However, since I live in colder climate, if the temps are in the upper to mid 30s, the headphones only last 15 mins at the most. Even if I wear a hoodie, they don't last much longer. This happens when the battery is fully charged, so there must be a shutoff when the headphones hit a certain temp. The battery doesn't drain, it just turns off. I would not buy these again.

After 6 months, the ear cover has separated and cannot be easily fixed. Apple support was not much help and repair would be at cost plus $100 RT uber ride to a service provider 20 miles away. My second pair of Beats that has not lived up to the hype of the Apple quality expected

The right ear shorted out after 3 months. The left ear scratches out now 4 months after I bought them. I'm really unhappy. I don't use them near water or anything strange that would lead to the short out.

My first time spending $200 on headphones and was impressed with battery life and quality of music for a year. I connect them via Bluetooth as I have on very flight and the right earphone has no sound. I spend every minute u til takeoff trying to google remedies and disconnect/reconnect and reset. I didn’t get them wet, used the case religiously. If I had known they wouldn’t last 13 months I would not have spent that much. Very disappointed.

I was super excited to get these headphones. After about 20 minutes of wearing them, i took them off and my ears were throbbing! They are very painful to wear. I can't get past the pain so I'll be returning these, which is unfortunate because the sound is amazing and they fit me way better then the Bose soundlink headphones.

Stylish and sound great, but stopped working properly after less than a year. One of the ears goes in and out depending on your head position. A wire is probably a little loose on the inside. As pricey as these are I'd expect them to be more durable after being stored in the case and only being used lightly for a year.

Luckily they still had 6 days left on their one year warranty and Apple repaired them for free.

My daughter absolutely loves her new Beats, she hasn’t heard a thing anyone has said to her since Christmas morning.
All kidding aside the headphones themselves are very nice. They have amazing sound quality, and they look and feel great. It took my daughter all of 3min to connect to her phone, set them up, and start listening to music.
Will buy another pair for myself, so that I can pretend not to hear my wife.

These are my first over the ear headphones. They pair easily with my iPhone and my Microsoft Surface Laptop for calls and music on both devices. The sound quality is good and people say they hear me clearly. I haven’t tried outdoor calls yet where it may pick up other environmental sounds.

The only negative is they get a bit uncomfortable on my ears when I wear them for longer periods. I think the ear cushions could be softer.

Next time I’ll consider spending more for more comfortable headphones.

Love these. The battery life on these last a reeeallly long time. Ear cups aren’t very large so they don’t comfortably cover the whole ear.

Easy Bluetooth connect. Wish you could Bluetooth phone calls as well. You need a wire (that comes with it) to speak on the phone.

I thought the sound was excellent with these but the fit was terrible. It has that clamping effect and were really not comfortable at all. I was disappointed because I had been wanting a pair of Beats for so long! These had to go back and the search continues.

I just got and they are real unlike what the comments say. I registered them and everything. The battery life is great so far and the mic is great. I’m not sure how they’ll last in the long run but only time will tell at this point.

3 weeks in: I really enjoy the long battery life on these things and they’re still working perfectly.

Bought these for my sons birthday and he absolutely loves them!! I don’t personally use them but my son loves them he uses them all the time and has not once complained about them. They work as described. Well worth the money and the smile it has put on my sons face. I recommend these beats!

My cousin needed these for her birthday, so I bought it for her. It was pretty good, she liked these so much. I have also tried these myself and over all sound quality is very good. The bass is okay, but not much deep bass with these. However, these do have the noise cancellation feature which is very good and works very well. Overall, I would say my cousin likes these.

Have wanted an excellen pair of Dr. Dre's Beats..especially before they became impossible to find.
These DO NOT disappoint! Noise cancelling, perfect (adapts to background). Clear sound with great bass that doesn't overpower!
Couldn't be happier with this product! I'll update this review if I'm not completely satisfied with my headphones!

I bought these expecting to get quality sound but was very disappointed , the sound was like a cheap headphone, the fit was tight and uncomfortable and my ears left hot after a hour of use, i use them for a day or two and then stop using them, i gave them to a family member.

Love love love, been wanting to purchase one of these for a while, saw it in some other sites but was expensive. Beautiful, sounds great and I like the fact that it folds and comes with a little carry on case.
Won’t trade it for nothing, still enjoying it and no problems so far. I think it’s the best by far.

First thing that stood out to me was the color. I am a rose gold addict lol. The next thing was how comfortable these are. Those squishy ear pieces are amazing. The battery on these seem to last forever, which is great! The sound is crisp and clean. The only thing I'm disappointed with is the bass... there just isn't enough.

Great sound and are compact so they are able to fit into smaller bags when they are folded. The battery lasts pretty long, I was quite surprised. I hardly ever have to charge them and I use them almost daily for the gym. The only complaint I have is they're not comfortable when wearing with glasses. They're a big snug on the ear so they do start to hurt a little when wearing your glasses.

Your used headphones purchased at full price may come with cat fur, earwax and dandruff like mine. That’s nasty.
Also, no cords included for these Bluetooth headphones. Just the used headphones in the case inside the beats box.
This is the second pair I’ve ordered and really not worth the hassle. Disappointed in Amazon’s quality control.

I love these headphones! The battery is amazing, I didn’t charge it for the first month or so that I used it, and sound quality is also great. I mostly use them in my studio while working, super comfortable to wear for a long time.
I did not had any problems with the shipping/packaging. The box was in great condition, unopened, in original packing and everything was included.

Great headphones. A little tight on ears at first, once broken in amazing sound, excellent battery life, and very comfortable. I have 3 pairs of wireless headphone and these are by far my favorite. If your in the market at 200$ range, stop buy these and be happy.

Also, these block out the world around you. Not recommend for long walks on a busy road with no side walk, you will not here it coming!

I'm very pleased with my purchase! Easy to connect to my Samsung S8 plus. My Beats came fully charged, and I've been using them since I took them out of the box! I've been to the gym and on public transportation! They don't necessarily block out background noise, but they're a great distraction! I am very happy! Don't think of the price! You only live once, and these headphones make life great! I definitely recommend these awesome headphones!

This is a good stuff. I've used it for a long time. Not any issues. But I don't know how to discuss it. I just want to clean up the review. Because when I look at the review which hasn't reviewed that I will feel uncomfortable. That's it.

I got the glossy black. Love this product. It's legit. Battery lasts a long time. Glossy black does not scratch easily. I even hit it HARD against a piece of equipment at the gym and the dent is still so tiny and not noticeable - so it is DURABLE.

My husband loved these. They were great with his low hearing. However, they do not stand up to use while working. They have never been wet, always kept in the case. And just after the end of warranty they quit working. We think it’s because they couldn’t stand up to use while sweating. Can’t come up with any other reason for them to just quit like that after being so well taken care of. It was almost like they shorted. He was wearing them and everything was fine mowing then lawn and the boom, they were dead.

I bought these as a gift. When I opened them, I was disappointed to see that the black material did not completely cover the ear phones on either side. The beige foam sticks out all around the ear phones on both sides. When I try to stretch the black material across the earphone to cover the foam—it won’t go--it’s WAY too small and will not stay in place.
If they don’t bother to refurbish them enough to make them look good on the outside, it’s doubtful that quality work was done inside. NO ATTENTION TO DETAIL.
A. Fox, (Texas)

Best bluetooth headphone. Period. Quality is good but most important is you dont need to pair unpair anymore in order to connect to your phone, mac, ipad, watch. It connects to all at once and while listening music from mac if you get a call on iphone then you can just switch to iphone and vice versa. This is a great feature. When I go for jog then I just connect to my watch without unpairing. I have two and my daughter loves it as she can use between her laptop, phone and ipad.

The best headphones out there. Got them for my wife for Christmas and she loves them. Great deal and great quality of item. Cant beat prime with 2 day shipping. These were out of stock everywhere. Can answer calls and hang up, listen to music wireless with great quality, and charges fast.

Just got these babies today! So excited! Came in about 4 bus days. Original packaging, looks amazing. Sound quality is amazing. Was 92% charged when I put charger on and charged for about 10 min and they were ready to go. I’m very satisfied! I got the matte black, looks classy. These are a plus for me since those dang iphone buds don’t fit in my ear. Love, love, love!

I love color and they where awesome to 4 times I got to use them. Bought these a year ago in January
I have taken very good care of them . I charged them last night so I could use them today and they would not pair. the pair light wont even come on. so I plugged them in to use and sound only comes out on the right and nothing on the right ! In my opinion . 300.00 is way to much to spend on something you only got to use 4 times. Ive had cheap ear phones that last way longer and when they bite the dust you can afford to replace them . Very Disappointed in this purchase

I bought as a gift and these were good headphones, very good for using with ipods and phones. It came in good packaging, very pretty, and is easy to use. I bought at a great price during the Fall season and I had no problems with delivery. Thank you for a great product!

Color is dynamite. Got these for my bf for his bday and h3s obsessed. He had a pair of army green ones that he lost on a flight and this was his next favorite color since the green was discontinued. I think I might like this color even better now

My 15yr old g.daughter loves her"BEATS".l got them for her B'day. She loves her GMa too! Lol.Oh.has great sound quality.nice and compact.eventhough a nice case comes in the box with them,l purchased a "sweet"shell case thingee.She loves that too.The BEATS are silver and the case l purchased separately is also silver.oh.also purchased from AMAZON of course!

First of all, it’s Mickey!!! These headphones paired to my iPad so easy, I have a lot of Bluetooth items and these paired the easiest I have ever experienced. The battery life is good, and the sound quality is superb.

Bought these for my teenage daughter for Christmas she loves them. I did put them on and wow are they comfortable and the sound quality is great! She was amazed how far from her phone she could get and still not be disconnected. I know this is something she will use for a long time. They are a great color in the silver and the quality is great!

I bought these for a Christmas present (i’m an early shopper). When my son opened them on Christmas, they would not work and the window for returns had already closed. There’s not even a way to contact the seller to explain my situation? Beyond annoying! Now it’s on my list of To do’s to try and figure out if they can be fixed. These were way too expensive for such disappointment- in the product AND the lack of customer service

These are a gift for someone else so I haven't used them, but I just wanted to report that the headphones I received are authentic. I saw several reviews about receiving fakes and was concerned, but all is well here!

This is my first and last time buying from Beats. The pictures I posted speaks a 1000 words. I used these headphones for only a few months. Never dropped them, never used them hard, never used in rain, I took care of them. They mostly stayed in the case inside my bag. Please look at the pics before you make a purchase decision.

Material around the are ear headphones are separated after reading many reviews there seems to be ongoing problem I called Apple but they want to hold a credit card on file and have them mailed in. Considering the PRICE of these headphones they should be backing up their product...other than that they have a very good sound and battery life on them are very good.

I had bought 1 powerbeats and it quit on me after a firmware update, got it replaced with another one and it quit for no reason, all this within 1 1/2 years. Bought a solo 3 just a couple of months ago and now it will not stay connected via BT. Called support and walked me thru the reset steps, which i had already done, now they say send it in. i'M SICK OF PAYING BIG BUCKS (224.00) NOT HAVING IT FOR MORE THAN 2 YEARS AND HAVE TO GET IT REPLACED. GONNA BUY A BOSE BEADSET!!
LOVE these headphones. Mainly use them with an iPad. Soft, comfortable, noise cancelling, easy to connect... perfect! Definitely worth the money.

Great headphones for all purposes unless you plan on wearing them when the temperature drops near 32°F or below. These headphones have a wonderfully long battery life, effortless connections to I-devices, good sound and great usability. My problem, and it’s a big one, is that is impossible to use these headphones as a wireless device when the temperature drops close to or below freezing. At that point, the headphones turn off automatically anywhere from 5 minutes to 20 minutes later depending on how cold it is. Sometimes, when the temperatures only at 32°, I can get up to 20 to 25 minutes before they turn off. I have called Apple and I have been told that this is typical for battery powered wireless headphones. I have not substantiated this statement with other brands.

For the price doesnt sound that good its just ok it lacks mid its mostly bass its not worth $199 or $129 on sale .jbl live 400 sounds better for $ 69 ..but quality its really good.im not sure im keeping it ill try for a week will see

Super great headphones ever have. Was having a wired Philips and a SONY headphone, but always felt painful on both ears because wrapping too tightly to ears. This Beats Solo3 doesn't make such problem to me.

In terms of BT/wireless, it works wonderfully as I have many apple products and the Solo3 connects to all of them with easy set up and very good music quality. The long durability of battery juice and long distance of reception make me thumbs up!! I work in a lab often leave my phone on desk and walk around benches and even cross the hall way to another room. I never get problem to receive BT signals from my iphone7. It's also easy to check battery status using iphone.

I had another pair of these that I ordered from Apple that were stolen and I was devastated because I love them so much that I ordered another pair. They are sound cancelling and comfortable sitting over the ear. I was never into bulky headphones like this before but after owning these I probably won't get anything else. I even use them when I shoot my gun because the noise cancelling is that good. I recommend them if you are considering buying them!

Great headset. Flawless pairing with all your apple devices. Legitimate 40 hours battery life and the range across our 3 level home no drops at all. The fatal flaw is i like to walk the dog in winter; if its cold; the unit shuts off purposely at around 32 degrees and no more music for the rest of the walk; i had 2 when i realized this i returned 1. They get more comfortable with continued use; not as comfy as the bose on ear bluetooth. Overall good purchase.

Wow. If you are a bass lover and primarily listen to rap or R&B, you are certainly in for a treat. These look great and although the clarity is not quite as good as other brands such as Bose or Sennheiser, they excel in the bass department. They are sleek and beautiful making these the best looking headphones money can buy and won’t stick out if you so chose to wear them with your favorite outfit. Overall, I strongly recommend these to just about anybody looking for a great overall headphone with great sound quality, bass, battery, aesthetics, and style all in one.

these are awful . at first I was really happy to get them and they looked really authentic and sounded great ! I’ve had them for almost a year now and as I was dancing and listening to my music, the right speaker stopped working . not to mention the circle part that allows you to change the volume randomly fell off on its own while I was listening to music maybe 6 months back . for 6 months I have been having it taped to my headphones just for them to end up trash all together . just save the money because these ain’t it .

If you like loud music beware. The wireless on these does not allow for loud music. I tested my regular Beats Solo with the same music and phone and the wireless just wont get as loud. I sent them back. Would rather deal with wires instead of not being able to enjoy loud music.

What more can be said. The main thing you probably want to know is it new and does it look as advertised. Answer is yes to both. I just bought a second set for my son for him to use at the gym. He loves them.
Got these for my grandson he just loves the sound. He says they are great. I listened to them one time myself. They do sound fine to me

My daughter got these for Christmas and absolutely loves them. Shes able to run without them falling off or out of her ears and they keep the outside noise out completely!! The sound is so crisp and clear! Couldnt be happier!

I bought these for my 9 year old for his birthday and we both love them. (I use them at the gym occasionally and have even run in them). The battery lasts forever and they look sharp but not too bulky. They are comfortable and the sound is very good. I like that they fold up nicely to fit in a small case that is easy to toss into a backpack or purse. I have been very happy with this purchase and I love the gold color. Not too flashy but still cool looking.

I have had these for about a year and a half and the left earphone stopped working. If you do research, this is a VERY VERY common problem and it is not an easy fix or you'll have to send it in for repair which costs a significant amount of money. Extremely disappointed that I paid this much for head phones that barely last - and mine are in pristine condition physically. I gave Beats a chance after ignoring all the 'haters' online, and now I wish I would have listened. NEVER AGAIN. Do yourself a favor and look at Bose, Sony, etc. it is not worth it.

Mine are real Beats headphones, so I don't know what the other people are talking about. Great quality sound! Also I love that these are made with a female's head shape in mind, it fits well on a smaller female's head and ears.Very comfortable too! I love the rose gold because it matches my iPhone!

Absolutely best sound I’ve heard from headphones ever! You can’t get any better quality then what I got from Beats. My only issue is that I have large ears so I’m exchanging this pair for a different color for my daughter and I’m getting the larger size.

No active noise cancellation, the ear cups blocks some sound. I like the 40 hours play on single charge but ears get way too hot and sweaty! Little too tight for long uses, hopefully it will stretch out in time. Used it with the headphone jack and Bluetooth, the Bluetooth never dropped off. Let’s see if the sound quality gets better with use.

I actually like these and I am the furthest thing in the world from a Beats guy. The sound is fun they actually feel good on my head. Are the worth the $300 list price? Probably not but I got mine for $200 and you could probably do better than that. I just hope they hold up. Recommended.

they fit a little tight on my head which makes it uncomfortable, but otherwise they are great. they charge so fast which is great! when you don’t have the headphones on you can hear what they are playing i would say pretty loudly, but i knew they were supposed to do that but people can easily hear what your listening to even if the it is at a very low volume.

Product has excellent sound quality and quick charging. The audio cord was broken when I received it. Thought no big deal since it was brand new and still under warranty. I was totally mistaken. When I called Apple to get a new cord, I was told that it was already out of warranty by two years. What??? The warranty started when the product was purchased two years ago by the seller (AMAZON) from Apple. Now that I know this, I will be very careful about what I purchase from Amazon. I ended up paying for a new audio cord.

I bought these headphones for my son who is autistic and hopes that it would help cancel out some of the noise around us while he was watching videos or listening to music. So far they have worked wonders and have really helped him be able to be in big groups of people and change from different settings from loud to quiet.

There is no active noise cancellation. The best things for this headphones are: the bass and the calling quality . I used this headphone for all my calls. Nice
Only thing I don’t like is you can not wear for a long time . Too tight

I did not know what all the fuss was about Beats, but these are one of the 'lower' level Beats and I love them. Works every time with bluetooth and great sound and unless you are a huge sound aficionado and have to have the highest tech available these are fantastic.

Very disappointed that the headset is already broken - right side speaker cuts in and out or just doesn't work at all. :( Was searching for product support and just saw it had expired on Sept. For the amount of $$ spent, I expected it to be more durable - especially since I take very good care of everything I own and don't throw it around or drop it.

I read the good & bad reviews of this product & have to say the bad reviews are unwarranted!!!! These headphones are awesome- 100% authentic & completely packaged. I purchased a pair for my son a few months ago from a licensed dealer, so we know what to expect & were completely satisfied. Sound quality is top notch - comfort on over the ear is perfect... anyone looking for a pair of outstanding earphones-PURCHASE THESE!!!!!
